Required Qualifications

Bachelors degree preferred, or years of relevant business experience.

Proven experience as a Business Analyst in the insurance industry.

Strong understanding of insurance operations processes (claims, underwriting, policy administration).

Proficient in Microsoft Office, particularly Excel.

Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple priorities.

Self-starter, ability to work with minimal supervision.

Great communicator comfortable working in a dynamic team environment.

title: Business Analyst
description:
Job Description:

TOP THINGS:

- Asset Work Management, Electric Generation Interconnection (EGI)

- utilities similar to PG&E

- SAP Work and Asset Management focusing on Electric Distribution, Transmission, Substation

- Good to have: Power gen exp ( MSP note: assets for Power Generation, could be hydro, electric, etc.)

- Good to have: SAP Module: Field Service Management - Very good to have




Responsibilities:




Responsible for the concurrent management of one or more medium to large complex IT Business Technology projects. These projects are one-time, multitask jobs that have clearly defined start and end dates, a specific scope of work, a budget, required resources, and a specified performance objective to be achieved. Specific responsibilities include:




• Works with stakeholders and project team to elicit, analyze, validate and prioritize the business needs/requirements

• Conducts interviews to gather customer requirements via workshops, questionnaires, surveys, site visits, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios, and other methods

• Identifies and establishes scope and parameters of requirements analysis on a project-by-project basis to define project impact, outcome criteria, and metrics

• Analyzes and verifies requirements for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility, and conformity to standards

• Participates in the QA of purchased solutions to ensure features/functions have been enabled and optimized

• Participates in the selection of any software solutions that the organization may opt to use

• Develops and utilizes standard templates to accurately and concisely write requirements specifications

• Translates conceptual customer requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to developers/project team

• Creates process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and/or the project team

• Develops and conduct peer reviews of the business requirements to ensure that requirement specifications are correctly interpreted

• Assists with the interpretation of customer requirements into feasible options, and communicating these back to the business stakeholders

• Manages, enforce and redefine (as necessary) the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle

• Communicates changes, enhancements, and modifications of business requirements — verbally or through written documentation — to project managers, sponsors, and other stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood

• Participates in the testing effort throughout the project lifecycle, including test script creation




Minimum Qualifications:

• BA/BS in Computer Science/ Information Systems, Business, Engineering, etc. or equivalent work experience

• 5+ years of related experience or equivalent

• Experience in Waterfall, Agile and Scrum methodology

• Proven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification, and methodology development

• Proven experience with business IT applications

• Ability to lead and influence decision-making working with senior management at PG&E

• Able to exercise independent judgment and take action on it

• Excellent analytical, mathematical, and creative problem-solving skills

• Excellent listening, interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills

• Logical and efficient, with keen attention to detail

• Highly self-motivated and directed

• Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks while under pressure

• Strong customer service orientation • Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment

• Experience with MS Visio, Excel and PowerPoint

• Working knowledge of SQL




Desired:

• Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Business Administration • Experience working with Electric Generation Interconnection program • Experience working with Electric Distribution/Transmission/Substation work and asset management processes • Demonstrated ability to lead and deliver on significant technology solutions/business process improvements from concept to implementation

title: Business Analyst
description:
Genesis10 is seeking a Business Analyst for a contract with our client in Denver or Minneapolis.

Position Overview:

We are seeking a Systems/Business Analyst to support ongoing enhancements and capital projects, primarily focusing on a SailPoint upgrade. This role is essential for automating processes, reducing manual workloads, and ensuring the smooth implementation of identity access management solutions. The successful candidate will play a critical role in gathering requirements, translating them into agile stories, and collaborating closely with development teams using tools like JIRA. This position offers the opportunity to work across various teams and systems, with a focus on automating workflows and streamlining processes.

Key Responsibilities:


 * Support SailPoint upgrade and related capital projects, ensuring automation of processes to reduce manual work.
 * Collaborate with the SailPoint team and technical support teams to implement system upgrades and process improvements.
 * Gather and document business and technical requirements, translating them into actionable tasks within an agile environment.
 * Work with developers to ensure requirements are clear and well-understood for implementation.
 * Support ongoing identity access management projects into 2025 and beyond.
 * Participate in daily agile stand-ups, sprint reviews, and other agile ceremonies to ensure smooth project execution.
 * Engage with internal stakeholders to identify areas for process improvement and automation.
   
   

Daily Activities:


 * Attend daily stand-ups and sprint reviews.
 * Collaborate with technical teams to gather and document requirements for automation projects.
 * Ensure clear communication and translation of business needs into technical specifications for development teams.
 * Monitor and provide feedback on ongoing project progress and automation efforts.
   
   

Skills & Qualifications:


 * Experience: 5-7 years as a Business Analyst or Systems Analyst in a technical, process-driven environment.
 * Process Expertise: Strong ability to analyze and automate workflows, with a focus on reducing manual processes.
 * Agile Methodology: Experience working in an agile environment, including participation in stand-ups, sprint reviews, and backlog grooming.
   
   

Work Hours: Standard full-time hours, with flexibility during critical phases.

Duration: 12 months (potential for extension or permanent placement)

Likelihood of Extension: High probability of extension or conversion to a permanent role based on performance.

Compensation:

Hourly W2 pay rate $

We have access to additional contract, contract-to-hire, and direct hire positions with various rate ranges.

If you have the described qualifications and are interested in this exciting opportunity, apply today!

Ranked a Top Staffing Firm in the U.S. by Staffing Industry Analysts for six consecutive years, Genesis10 puts thousands of consultants and employees to work across the United States every year in contract, contract-for-hire, and permanent placement roles. With more than 300 active clients, Genesis10 provides access to many of the Fortune 100 firms and a variety of mid-market organizations across the full spectrum of industry verticals.

Benefits of Working with Genesis10:


 * Access to hundreds of clients, most who have been working with Genesis10 for 5-20+ years.
 * The opportunity to have a career-home in Genesis10; many of our consultants have been working exclusively with Genesis10 for years.
 * Access to an experienced, caring recruiting team (more than 7 years of experience, on average.)
 * Behavioral Health Platform
 * Medical, Dental, Vision
 * Health Savings Account
 * Voluntary Hospital Indemnity (Critical Illness & Accident)
 * Voluntary Term Life Insurance
 * 401K
 * Sick Pay (for applicable states/municipalities)
 * Commuter Benefits (Dallas, NYC, SF)
 * Remote opportunities available
   
   

For multiple years running, Genesis10 has been recognized as a Top Staffing Firm in the U.S., as a Best Company for Work-Life Balance, as a Best Company for Career Growth, for Diversity, and for Leadership, amongst others. To learn more and to view all our available career opportunities, please visit us at our website.

title: Business Process Analyst
description:
Job Title: Business Process Analyst

Location: Remote

We are currently seeking candidates who meet the following qualifications

Responsibilities


 * Collaborate with stakeholders to grasp business objectives and requirements.
 * Analyze current business processes to pinpoint areas for improvement and efficiency gains.
 * Design and document new business processes and workflows.
 * Create and maintain process maps, flowcharts, and visual aids to illustrate process enhancements.

title: Business Analyst
description:
Job Description

Project Planning and Management - Manage projects, including defining, executing, and tracking project plan; preparing and distributing progress reports; escalating risks and issues to the Senior Portfolio and Program Manager if needed.

Business Analysis - Partner with stakeholders and development team to elicit, analyze and document business requirements and translate into technical requirements.

Qualifications


 * Minimum of 3-5 years of Project Management experience and a minimum of 1 year of Business Analyst experience.
 * Project Management experience in implementing Salesforce Solutions in an Agile Project and working with vendor consultants preferred.
 * Experience in creating documents, such as Project Charters, Business Requirement Documents, Software Requirement Documents, Process workflows, User guides/Training materials among others.
 * Solid understanding of Project Management methodologies and practices to be able to work closely with a PM and seamlessly move into the PM role on occasion.
 * Experience with evaluating project risks and issues and assisting Program Manager/Portfolio Manager with prioritization and development of mitigation or resolution strategies.
 * Ability to develop strong client/vendor relationships and develop strategies and solutions of high business value.
 * Ability to apply project management knowledge to real world scenarios. Agile Project Methodology and JIRA knowledge preferred.
 * Experience in facilitating requirement analysis sessions with large and diverse stakeholder groups through requirements meetings, workshops, JAD sessions etc.
 * Possess the ability to read, analyze and interpret general business documents and governmental regulations; to write clear and legible documents, business correspondence and procedure manuals; to effectively present information and respond to questions from managers, employees, vendors, and governmental agencies.
 * Experience with analyzing inefficient business processes (manual entry, old technology, migrations, etc.) and working with business stakeholders and IT partners to create requirements for effective IT solutions.
 * Experience in creating visual diagrams of the system by UML (Use case, Activity, Business Process Diagrams), and creating web page mock-ups.
 * Proficient with MS Office; including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Visio.
 * Attentive to detail and possess an ability to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
 * Possess Bachelor's Degree or at least 3 years related experience in a technical environment.

title: Junior Business Process Analyst
description:

The ideal candidate will have a keen interest in analyzing business processes, identifying areas for improvement, and assisting in the implementation of solutions that enhance operational efficiency. This role offers an excellent opportunity for recent graduates or early-career professionals to develop their skills and grow within the company.

title: Business Analyst
description:
Requirements

Description and Requirements

The Team You Will Join

This is an integral role within MetLife’s Corporate Systems Technology organization supporting the Employee Experience (EE) organization which touches every employee of MetLife. This is an exciting time to join the Corporate Systems Technology organization as we collaborate with business leaders and continue to transform MetLife’s Employees Experience.

The Opportunity

The Employee Experience (EE) team consists of several technology focused teams supporting the enterprise. The selected candidate will manage EE Agile practices across all teams and be responsible for Senior Level product and process reporting for all teams within our portfolio.

How You’ll Help Us Build a Confident Future (Key Responsibilities)


 * Establish knowledge of business challenges and priorities to identify opportunities and recommend technical solutions with action plans that improve ongoing business operation and overall employee experience in ways that add value to MetLife
 * Support Product Owner in leading requirement analysis and decomposition, design, internal testing, and the creation of user stories
 * Collaborate across EE stakeholders and functional teams to recommend solutions that deliver successful digital capabilities using an agile approach and SAFe methodologies
 * Provide leadership throughout the lifecycles of a project, promoting its vision through design and development to ensure project requirements are satisfied
 * Develop meaningful and lasting relationships with partners for optimized support and respond to questions and concerns from managers and executives with supporting research and recommendations
 * Fosters a continuous improvement mindset and enjoys exploring innovative enhancement opportunities
   
   
   

What You Need To Succeed (Required Qualifications)


 * 3+ years of experience in the Business Analyst role for software development
 * Extensive experience in designing solutions for business challenges - Demonstrated ability to work with others to gather requirements and translate them into meaningful user stories and specifications
 * Excellent organization and time management skills with the ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment that requires the individual to simultaneously manage several projects, with tight deadlines, while paying attention to detail and quality.
 * Excellent interpersonal and communication skills – able to articulate and present ideas and solutions in clear and concise fashion to business partners, colleagues, and senior business leaders
   
   
   

What Can Give You An Edge (Additional Skills)


 * Excellent problem solving, quantitative and analytical skills, critical thinking, and the ability to effectively work through abstract concepts
 * Demonstrable experience of managing large, complex IT projects
 * Working experience with Power BI or other data visualization and analytics tools is a plus
 * Working experience with Azure DevOps (AZDO) or other business requirement tools
 * Self-motivated with curiosity to understand and investigate what is possible
 * Ability to effectively adapt to rapidly changing technology and apply it to business needs
 * Flexible and adaptable attitude, disciplined to manage multiple responsibilities and adjust to varied environments
   
   
   

The salary range for applicants for this position is $95,000-$118,000.

Benefits We Offer

Our U.S. benefits address holistic well-being with programs for physical and mental health, financial wellness, and support for families. We offer a comprehensive health plan that includes medical/prescription drug and vision, dental insurance, and no-cost short- and long-term disability. We also provide company-paid life insurance and legal services, a retirement pension funded entirely by MetLife and 401(k) with employer matching, group discounts on voluntary insurance products including auto and home, pet, critical illness, hospital indemnity, and accident insurance, as well as Employee Assistance Program (EAP) and digital mental health programs, parental leave, volunteer time off, tuition assistance and much more!

About MetLife

Recognized on Fortune magazine's list of the 2024 "World's Most Admired Companies" as well as the 2024 Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For ®, MetLife , through its subsidiaries and affiliates, is one of the world’s leading financial services companies; providing insurance, annuities, employee benefits and asset management to individual and institutional customers. With operations in more than 40 markets, we hold leading positions in the United States, Latin America, Asia, Europe, and the Middle East.

Our purpose is simple - to help our colleagues, customers, communities, and the world at large create a more confident future. United by purpose and guided by empathy, we’re inspired to transform the next century in financial services. At MetLife, it’s #AllTogetherPossible . Join us!

Equal Employment Opportunity/Disability/Veterans

title: Business Analyst
description:
Job Description


 * PRCH is seeking an IT Business Analyst Contractor to join our team.
 * Gather and analyze current workflow documentation from as-is to a to-be state for e-procurement implementation.
 * Conduct business process review based on interviews with staff and reviewing current documented processes.
 * Work closely with the e-procurement Project Manager, Systems Administrator, Purchasing leadership, and various County stakeholders to prepare for and implement an e-procurement system.
 * Manage process changes related to the transition from manual to automated workflows.
 * Recommend, develop, and lead change management strategies impacting internal resources, agency partners, external vendors, and the public.
 * Develop and understand how business needs will impact implementation, working with teams to adjust processes and document accordingly.
 * Conduct meetings with the appropriate subject matter experts in business to gather requirements, analyze, and finalize documentation.
 * Assists in writing test scripts, test cases, and testing results.
 * Work closely with the operational functional teams, operations management and personnel, agency partners, and various technology teams to facilitate a common understanding of requirements.
 * Provide training to new PRCH staff and agency partners.
   
   

Qualifications


 * The requirements below represent the knowledge, skills, and abilities expected of successful candidates.
 * Strong leadership, interpersonal, influence, negotiation, organization & communication skills.
 * Analytical thinker who can adapt standard processes and procedures to large and complex initiatives.
 * Ability to facilitate customer requirements, including participation in defining requirements.
 * Demonstrates ability to handle the required business development tasks and assist in developing and maintaining client relationships.
 * In-depth understanding of requirements definition approaches, including pros/cons, functional decomposition, and use cases.
 * Accomplished using industry best practices for gathering and documenting complete and detailed requirements.
 * Self-starter, motivated, independent, versatile team player, and work well under pressure.
 * Excellent written skills are required.

title: Business Analyst (Healthcare)
description:
Garnet River® is a full-service information technology company that customizes solutions for its clients. We solve challenges through staff augmentation, project-based teams and technical solutions. Our staffing division works as a recruiting arm for companies in the region and across the country. Clients turn to us to help them find professional talent.




We are currently seeking a Business Analyst to join our team in Albany, NY. This is a hybrid position and requires approximately 50% onsite presence.




Job Description:

The Business Analyst will work with the Project Director, Project Manager, and cross-functional teams to support the implementation of high-profile departmental initiatives. Within the systems development life cycle, the Business Analyst will take an active role in the business and technical aspects of design and problem resolution and act as a liaison between the project and stakeholders.




Job Responsibilities:

 * Eliciting, documenting, reviewing, and obtaining approval of business and requirements from key stakeholders using industry standard methods.
 * Conducting and leading requirements gathering sessions; analyzing requirements gathered; identifying, documenting, and validating system requirements for continuous integration and deployment.
 * Preparing proposals for best fit technology based on requirements elicited.
 * Reviewing and documenting system As-Is state and proposing the To-Be state.
 * Creating requirements documentation such as: Use cases, Screen prototypes, Specifications, and adhering to pre-established templates and utilizing a requirements management tool.
 * Analyzing, extracting, transforming, and documenting legacy systems' functionality, system logic, business rules, and context diagrams.
 * Performing a gap analysis of COTS applications and their ability to meet implementation requirements.
 * Developing and presenting justifications for system or business process requirements.
 * Analyzing quantitative data to drive recommendations and decisions.
 * Evaluating and providing feedback on vendor deliverables and/or artifacts throughout the project life cycle.
 * Creating or improving existing templates for the business analysis functions.
 * Participating in project meetings and calls with State, project, and vendor staff.
 * Providing other business analysis support as required.




Minimum qualifications:

 * 6-8 years of experience working on complex projects as a Business Analyst.
 * Client focused business and requirements analysis experience and documentation.
 * Conducting business process analysis and optimization in a technology environment.
 * Creating requirements documentation.
 * Strong analytical, written, and verbal communication skills.
 * Bachelor’s or Master's’ degree with coursework in Information Technology, Business or Public Administration, Project Management and/or Communications.




Preferred Qualifications:

 * Familiarity with the Business Analysis Body of Knowledge (BABOK).
 * Ability to apply industry best practices and state/federal mandates to system requirements.
 * Experience identifying project risks/issues and proposing solutions.
 * Ability to work independently and manage work to a defined schedule.
 * Current Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) or similar.

title: Business Analyst
description:
Employment Type: Full-Time, Experienced

Department: Information Technology

CGS is looking for business analysts to work with a large federal agency! As a Business Analyst in Business operations and Content Strategy for CGS, you will partner with internal business owners and external partners to understand new business opportunities and define functional requirements.

CGS brings motivated, highly skilled, and creative people together to solve the government’s most dynamic problems with cutting-edge technology. To carry out our mission, we are seeking candidates who are excited to contribute to government innovation, appreciate collaboration, and can anticipate the needs of others. Here at CGS, we offer an environment in which our employees feel supported, and we encourage professional growth through various learning opportunities.

Skills and attributes for success:


 * Support the development of briefings, agendas, and other general documentation support as directed, including training material and demonstration sessions for new and existing technologies to various stakeholders
 * Document and analyze business and functional requirements so that they may be accurately translated into process maps and technical system requirements
 * Develop comprehensive documentation that meets organizational standards, to include but not limited to basic system architectural diagrams/wireframes, concepts of operations, monthly status reports
 * Create high-level briefings and communications materials for customers, management, and executive stakeholders
 * Work with the government and team members to identify, recommend, and implement opportunities for service delivery improvement and new technology implementation
 * Evaluate program materials and develop innovative approaches for improvement
 * Independently gather information from subject matter experts to develop, organize, and write procedure manuals, technical specifications, and process documentation
 * Develop and implement a deep understanding of Microsoft and Atlassian products and services (Teams, SharePoint, Visio, Jira, Confluence) to translate complex product information into simple, polished, and engaging content
 * Research, outline, write, and edit new and existing content, working closely with various team members to understand project requirements
 * Develop content in various media forms for maximum usability, with a consistent and cohesive voice across all documentation
 * Perform risk management, including identifying, prioritizing, and mitigating risks, and communicating and escalating risks and issues
 * Support a continuous improvement process by providing recommendations on improving products, services, and processes
 * Manage client interaction and expectations regarding team efforts
 * Identify and coordinate cross-team dependencies and collaboration
 * Continually seek opportunities to increase customer satisfaction, develop and deepen long-lasting client relationships
   
   
   

Qualifications:


 * Must be a U.S. Citizen
 * Bachelor's Degree (Computer Science, or engineering)
 * Must be able to successfully complete a stringent Background Investigation and obtain required Government Security clearance
 * 7+ years of experience in business analysis, systems analysis, and/or design of information systems programs and related business processes
 * Experience working with phase-based and Agile delivery methods
 * Experience with Jira or other Agile tools
 * Ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical users
 * Must be able to work well both in a team environment and independently
 * Must possess exceptional attention to detail
 * Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
 * Familiarity with government projects and policy/procedures teams
 * Demonstrates ability to interact comfortably with Senior Leadership and/or Government Executives and staff on a day-to-day basis
 * Experience in managing client requirements and small teams
 * Excellent analytical skills and business presentation skills
   
   
   

Ideally, you will also have:


 * Experience supporting DHS HQ or other US Federal Agencies
 * Experience tracking and reporting project or program delivery progress and budget execution
 * Experience developing project briefs and reports for non-technical audiences
 * Knowledge of the federal acquisition lifecycle
 * Familiarity with Business Intelligence and Data Analytics
 * Project Management, Agile, and/or Cyber Certifications (PMP / ACP / CSM / SAFe / CISM)
   
   
   

Our Commitment:

Contact Government Services (CGS) strives to simplify and enhance government bureaucracy through the optimization of human, technical, and financial resources. We combine cutting-edge technology with world-class personnel to deliver customized solutions that fit our client’s specific needs. We are committed to solving the most challenging and dynamic problems.

For the past seven years, we’ve been growing our government contracting portfolio, and along the way, we’ve created valuable partnerships by demonstrating a commitment to honesty, professionalism, and quality work.

Here at CGS we value honesty through hard work and self-awareness, professionalism in all we do, and to deliver the best quality to our consumers mending those relations for years to come.

We care about our employees. Therefore, we offer a comprehensive benefits package.


 * Health, Dental, and Vision
 * Life Insurance
 * 401k
 * Flexible Spending Account (Health, Dependent Care, and Commuter)
 * Paid Time Off and Observance of State/Federal Holidays
   
   
   

Contact Government Services, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will be considered without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Join our team and become part of government innovation!

Explore additional job opportunities with CGS on our Job Board:

https://cgsfederal.com/join-our-team/

For more information about CGS please visit: https://www.cgsfederal.com or contact:

Email: info@cgsfederal.com

title: Business Analyst
description:
Responsibilities

Kforce has a client that is seeking a Business Analyst in Miramar, FL. Summary: The role of the Business Analyst is to assist the business in assessing systems and user needs. This also includes managing multiple projects of a small to medium scale and scope as required. Responsibilities:


 * Business Analyst will facilitate business and functional requirements gathering
 * Ensure adherence and coordination with the PMO standards and processes
 * Serve as a liaison between the business and IT team
 * Review, analyze and evaluate business systems and user needs
 * Accurately document detailed description of the user needs, system functions and business requirements to develop or modify computer programs to optimize the implementation of software enhancements, changes and/or new software implementations
 * Conduct impact analysis and document customer business processes
 * Assist with project management for selected projects
 * As a Business Analyst, you will coordinate with different departmental teams to produce better business outcomes
 * Assist with testing of business processes and recommend improvements
 * Participate in root cause analysis to recommend process enhancements or other appropriate actions to improve products, with both the business units and IT
 * Map customer requirements to the company's products, create functional specifications for identified gaps and participate in solution implementation review
 * Maintain Scope and maintain project timelines
 * May perform other responsibilities as assigned
 * Responsibilities and duties may change due to operational needs
   
   

Requirements


 * Associate's degree or equivalent experience; Business Analysis Certificate, optional
 * 2-4 years of experience
 * Experience in writing comprehensive documentation that describes the project objectives, scope, and functionality
 * Experience in effective communication and be able to demonstrate a strong ability to speak and listen effectively to all levels within the organization, including executives
 * Knowledge of the SDLC with the ability to work within the defined roles and responsibilities
 * Comprehensive knowledge of system analysis concepts and techniques
 * Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite, Project, and Visio
 * Ability to effectively facilitate requirements gathering sessions, review and issue resolution involving multiple stakeholders
 * Domestic & International travel under 10% of time
 * Physical Effort: Exerts up to 10 lbs. of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull, or otherwise move objects, including the human body; Involves sitting most of the time but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time
 * Airline/Travel industry background or related field is preferred
   
   

The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

title: Business Analyst
description:
At Mojang Studios, the creators of Minecraft, we are on a mission to build a better world through the power of play.

Why play? Well, play is at the heart of everything we do. It’s the blocky backbone of our games, the core of our development philosophy, and even the origin of our name. From the relentless experimentation of our endlessly inspiring community to the classrooms where Minecraft has become an essential teaching tool, play is the bedrock of

our existence.

We enable millions to create and play together, connect people across the globe, and foster a community that is among the most active and passionate in the world. Our community is global and incredibly diverse. When we are developing anything within our franchise, we keep this in mind. We want everyone to not only feel included in Minecraft, but also to see themselves in what we make. Our goal is for the Mojang Studios team to be as diverse as our community.

We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented individual to join our team as a Business Analyst. The primary responsibility of this role is to ensure accurate and timely reporting and management of royalty statements and monitor financial obligations of worldwide partners. The successful candidate will bring technical expertise to ensure data quality and accuracy.  They will be responsible for validating, managing, and maintaining accurate records of royalty data in Excel, SQL, and Power BI, and will collaborate with cross-functional teams to invoice and track payment of royalties.  In addition, this person will project manage the on-boarding and maintenance of our new royalty management platform.

In the end, it’s the people of Mojang Studios that make this place truly special. When you join, you’ll find yourself in the company of incredibly bright, warm, and creative individuals – all united and working toward a single goal. Come help us reach it!

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

Responsibilities


 * Acquire data, develop, and maintain databases/data collection systems.
 * Monitor performance and quality control to identify efficiencies and improvements.
 * Take ownership of managing a seamless transition and onboarding process to migrate external partners onto a new royalty management platform; requires direct communication and developing relationships with external partners
 * Evaluate business processes, anticipate requirements, uncover areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions
 * Effectively communicate your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management
 * Monitor and maintain accurate financial records and status of partners to facilitate effective financial management, invoicing, and reporting
   
   

Embody our Culture & Values

Qualifications

Required Qualifications


 * Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Operations, Finance or related field
    * OR equivalent experience
      

Preferred Qualifications


 * A minimum of 3 years of experience in business analysis or a related field
 * Solid knowledge of and experience with databases (SQL), dashboards (Power BI); adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
 * Advanced knowledge of MS Excel and competency in MS Word and Outlook
 * Proficient analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
 * Highly self-motivated and driven, and a proactive problem-solver
 * Well planning, organizational, and time management skills
 * A track record of following through on commitments
   
   

Business Program Management IC2 - The typical base pay range for this role across the U.S. is USD $66,900 - $119,800 per year. There is a different range applicable to specific work locations, within the San Francisco Bay area and New York City metropolitan area, and the base pay range for this role in those locations is USD $89,600 - $134,400 per year.

Certain roles may be eligible for benefits and other compensation. Find additional benefits and pay information here: https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/us-corporate-pay

Microsoft will accept applications for the role until September 12, 2024.

title: US Prime Business Analyst, US Prime
description:
Description

Do you want to help drive growth and engagement with one of Amazon’s most important businesses? Do you enjoy using data and analytics to deliver actionable insights that support critical business decisions?

Amazon seeks an experienced business analyst to be a key member of the US Prime team. This is an exciting opportunity to support and influence the strategy of US Prime, with a focus on delivering data and insights on business performance.

As a US Prime Performance Business Analyst, you will partner with product, marketing, finance, and analytical professionals to provide data and insights that influence and support critical business decisions. The successful candidate will have shown experience in past roles influencing business owners and supporting decision making in rapidly evolving environments. This role requires a self-starter with strong modeling skills, a keen attention to detail, and an ability to manage multiple projects across several stakeholders effectively. This role also has regular interaction with various business units including North America Retail, Prime Video, Delivery Experience, and other key Prime benefit partners across Amazon, and requires strong interpersonal and communication skills.

Key job responsibilities


 * Serve as the key business performance partner working directly with product, marketing, finance, and other stakeholders across US and Worldwide Prime teams
 * Develop, launch, and optimize business performance mechanisms
 * Deliver data, analysis, insights, and recommendations to help shape business, product, and marketing strategies for US Prime
 * Lead business performance analysis and reporting, including preparation of weekly, monthly, and quarterly business reviews
 * Partner with Business, Product, Marketing, and Finance leaders to provide data-driven insights and recommendations that influence business decisions
   
   

About The Team

The US Prime team is focused on delivering the most engaging, satisfying, and loved membership program that drives the Amazon flywheel by growing the member base and accelerating engagement with Prime benefits.

Basic Qualifications


 * 5+ years of tax, finance or a related analytical field experience
 * 3+ years of writing SQL queries and creating business intelligence reports using Tableau, Power BI experience
 * Bachelor's degree
 * Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
 * Experience with Excel
 * Experience with SQL
 * Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders
   
   

Preferred Qualifications


 * MBA
   
   

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. title: Business Analyst
description:
What Working at Hexaware offers:

Hexaware is a dynamic and innovative IT organization committed to delivering cutting-edge solutions to our clients worldwide. We pride ourselves on fostering a collaborative and inclusive work environment where every team member is valued and empowered to succeed.

Hexaware provides access to a vast array of tools that enhance, revolutionize, and advance professional profile. We complete the circle with excellent growth opportunities, chances to collaborate with highly visible customers, chances to work alongside bright brains, and the perfect work-life balance.

With an ever-expanding portfolio of capabilities, we delve deep into and identify the source of our motivation. Although technology is at the core of our solutions, it is still the people and their passion that fuel Hexaware’s commitment towards creating smiles.

Role: Business Analyst with ETL Testing Experience

Location: Reston, VA

Experience: 8+ years

Work Mode: Reston, VA with minimum 3 days / week onsite is required)

Location: Client Location/Offshore

Salary Range: $115K




Job Key Responsibilities:







Job description:




Business Analyst with ETL Testing Experience

Job Description:

 * Business Analysis:
 * Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and document business requirements, focusing on Model implementation, secondary mortgage processes.
 * Develop detailed business requirements, process flows, and system documentation to support mortgage operations and risk management.
 * SQL Automation Testing:
 * Design, develop, and execute SQL queries to validate data accuracy, consistency, and completeness across systems.
 * Create and maintain automated test scripts to verify end-to-end functionality.
 * Collaborate with development teams to integrate automation testing within the CI/CD pipeline.
 * Model Risk Management:
 * Assist in the validation and testing of risk models used within the secondary mortgage market, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements.
 * Work with Model Risk Management teams to understand and document model usage, limitations, and testing protocols.
 * Support the development of test cases and scenarios to evaluate model performance and mitigate model risk.
 * Data Analysis and Reporting:
 * Perform in-depth data analysis to support business decisions and identify trends in mortgage data.
 * Generate reports and dashboards to communicate findings and provide actionable insights to stakeholders.
 * Ensure data integrity and accuracy in all reporting and analysis activities.
 * Stakeholder Communication:
 * Act as a liaison between business users, IT teams, and external vendors to ensure clear communication of requirements and deliverables.
 * Present findings and recommendations to senior management and other key stakeholders.

Provide ongoing support and training to business users on new systems and processes.

 * Review and analyze complex multi-faceted, larger scale, or longer-term Business Execution challenges that require in-depth evaluation of multiple factors including intangibles or unprecedented factors

title: Business Analyst
description:
CloudIQ offers you a portfolio of IT Cloud Management services that ensures high availability & and scalability, assured uptime, and reduced total cost of ownership. We provide comprehensive Cloud Infrastructure and Application Migration Services to help organizations around the globe optimize their mission-critical IT system and business processes. Our solution will enable customers to focus on their core business, whilst leaving us their infrastructure, to our team of Cloud Technical Experts. CloudIQ is a full-stack engineering solution provider with a focus on Application modernization and modern-day data analytics software stack development on Azure, AWS, and Kubernetes. It is one of the top 100 companies with certifications from Cloud native computing foundation and Microsoft. We are looking for talented individuals like you to work on exciting projects grow your career and realize your full potential.




We are looking for experienced BA candidates: 5 to 8 Yrs Exp




The ideal candidate is a team player who will be responsible for working with company data in various business areas. Specific responsibilities include reporting metrics, analyzing methodologies, suggesting operation improvements, and building proposal evaluations in a cross-functional environment.




Job Duties:

 * Supports the organization’s key business processes and applications and recommends business process redesign where applicable.
 * Gathers and documents business requirements for small to medium sized projects. Translates requirements into business, functional and use case documents for large, complex projects. Provides functional expertise to developers during the design and construction phases of projects.
 * Prepares and delivers informative, well-organized presentations and project status reviews to stakeholders including process owners, customers and stakeholders. Coordinates and oversees clarifications for requirements to ensure a streamlined development pipeline.
 * Analyzes and resolves production problems. Identifies and resolves data integrity issues. Develops and executes comprehensive system test plans, conditions, test scripts, and test cases.
 * Maintains business systems standards by applying business analysis methodologies, tools, and processes as standard practice.
 * Leads initiatives to develop solutions and processes to meet needs; identifies unique innovative approaches and other duties as assigned.




Knowledge & Abilities:

 * Working knowledge of methodologies and techniques for systems analysis and design, business process modeling, requirements gathering, quality assurance, and software development.
 * Agile or Scrum Methodologies
 * Microsoft Azure DevOps (ADO)
 * Proficiency with Business Analysis Body of Knowledge (BABOK) is preferred.
 * Ability to balance, prioritize and organize multiple tasks.
 * Ability to synthesize feedback and adjust plans accordingly.
 * Ability to build strong relationships inside and outside the organization.
 * Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in teams and across organizations.
 * Demonstrated ability to effectively translate user requirements into business, functional and test scenarios for projects of various sizes and complexity.
 * Demonstrated ability to develop and write technical documentation.




Skill in:

 * Strong customer service skills.
 * Excellent interpersonal, written and oral communication skills.
 * Proficient analytical skills to evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, consolidate details and extract to functional requirements.
 * Skills and competencies the position is the combination of soft skills, knowledge of business, system thinking, change management techniques, awareness in business changes in the economic environment and technology.




Responsibilities

 * Track and report data
 * Build cross-functional partnerships, internally and externally
 * Manage budgets
 * Maintain a competitive market knowledge




Qualifications

 * Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
 * Fluency in Microsoft Office suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)
 * Strong written, verbal, and collaboration skills




Compensation is competitive and commensurate with experience. Permanent employees are offered a full suite of Company Benefits:

 * Medical,
 * Dental,
 * vision insurance
 * Company-sponsored 401k.
 * Flexible Leave policy

title: Business Analyst
description:
Job Summary

As a Business Analyst you will play a crucial role in analyzing business processes, identifying areas for improvement, and providing data-driven insights to support decision-making. You will collaborate with stakeholders across various departments to gather requirements, develop solutions, and ensure that our projects align with strategic objectives.

Key Responsibilities


 * Requirements Gathering: Work closely with stakeholders to understand their needs and gather detailed requirements for business processes, systems, and projects.
 * Data Analysis: Analyze business data and metrics to identify trends, issues, and opportunities for improvement.
 * Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation including business requirements, process flows, use cases, and functional specifications.
 * Solution Development: Develop and propose solutions to business problems, including process improvements, system enhancements, and new technologies.
 * Project Management: Support project management activities including planning, execution, and monitoring to ensure project deliverables are met on time and within budget.
 * Stakeholder Communication: Facilitate communication between business units and technical teams to ensure clear understanding of requirements and project status.
 * Testing and Validation: Assist in the development of test plans and scenarios, and perform testing to ensure that solutions meet business needs and quality standards.
 * Training and Support: Provide training and support to end-users on new systems or processes.
   
   

Qualifications


 * Education: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, or a related field. Relevant certifications (e.g., CBAP, PMI-PBA) are a plus.
 * Experience: Experience as a Business Analyst or in a similar role. Experience in [specific industry] is advantageous.
 * Technical Skills: Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL), business intelligence platforms (e.g., Power BI, Tableau), and project management software.
 * Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data and provide actionable insights.
 * Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to present findings and recommendations clearly.
 * Interpersonal Skills: Proven ability to work collaboratively with diverse teams and stakeholders.
   
   

Benefits


 * Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses
 * Health, dental, and vision insurance
 * Retirement savings plan with company match
 * Paid time off and holidays
 * Professional development opportunities
 * Flexible work arrangements
   
   

As a platform committed to connecting top talent with the right roles, this job posting is exclusively available through Augment Jobs' proprietary job board.

title: Business Analyst
description:
Stafford Gray is seeking a talented Business Analyst to join our team. As a Business Analyst, you will work closely with multiple stakeholders, Subject Matter Experts (SMEs), and development teams to document business requirements and business flow diagrams. You will be responsible for enterprise-wide business analysis of web applications for the Office of Information Management (OIM) and its customers.

The ideal candidate has strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills. You should be detail-oriented, able to manage multiple tasks, and have a strong understanding of relational databases and system development lifecycle methodologies (SDLC). You should also have experience with project planning, requirements gathering, business process mapping, procedural writing, and process engineering. Knowledge and experience using multiple project management methodologies such as Waterfall, Iterative, and Agile is preferred.

If you are a self-motivated and proactive Business Analyst looking for an exciting opportunity to contribute to the success of our clients, we would love to hear from you.

Requirements

Requirements:


 * 7+ years of experience in business analysis, including knowledge of relational databases (SQL) and SDLC methodologies
 * Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
 * Ability to work closely with stakeholders, SMEs, and development teams
 * Experience with project planning, requirements gathering, and business process mapping
 * Detail-oriented with excellent organizational and time management skills
 * Excellent verbal and written communication skills
 * Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Information Systems, or related field
 * Preferred: Experience with healthcare information systems and knowledge of multiple project management methodologies such as Waterfall, Iterative, and Agile

title: Business Analyst
description:
Employment Type: Full-Time, Experienced

Department: Information Technology

CGS is looking for business analysts to work with a large federal agency! As a Business Analyst in Business operations and Content Strategy for CGS, you will partner with internal business owners and external partners to understand new business opportunities and define functional requirements.

CGS brings motivated, highly skilled, and creative people together to solve the government’s most dynamic problems with cutting-edge technology. To carry out our mission, we are seeking candidates who are excited to contribute to government innovation, appreciate collaboration, and can anticipate the needs of others. Here at CGS, we offer an environment in which our employees feel supported, and we encourage professional growth through various learning opportunities.

Skills and attributes for success:


 * Support the development of briefings, agendas, and other general documentation support as directed, including training material and demonstration sessions for new and existing technologies to various stakeholders
 * Document and analyze business and functional requirements so that they may be accurately translated into process maps and technical system requirements
 * Develop comprehensive documentation that meets organizational standards, to include but not limited to basic system architectural diagrams/wireframes, concepts of operations, monthly status reports
 * Create high-level briefings and communications materials for customers, management, and executive stakeholders
 * Work with the government and team members to identify, recommend, and implement opportunities for service delivery improvement and new technology implementation
 * Evaluate program materials and develop innovative approaches for improvement
 * Independently gather information from subject matter experts to develop, organize, and write procedure manuals, technical specifications, and process documentation
 * Develop and implement a deep understanding of Microsoft and Atlassian products and services (Teams, SharePoint, Visio, Jira, Confluence) to translate complex product information into simple, polished, and engaging content
 * Research, outline, write, and edit new and existing content, working closely with various team members to understand project requirements
 * Develop content in various media forms for maximum usability, with a consistent and cohesive voice across all documentation
 * Perform risk management, including identifying, prioritizing, and mitigating risks, and communicating and escalating risks and issues
 * Support a continuous improvement process by providing recommendations on improving products, services, and processes
 * Manage client interaction and expectations regarding team efforts
 * Identify and coordinate cross-team dependencies and collaboration
 * Continually seek opportunities to increase customer satisfaction, develop and deepen long-lasting client relationships
   
   
   

Qualifications:


 * Must be a U.S. Citizen
 * Bachelor's Degree (Computer Science, or engineering)
 * Must be able to successfully complete a stringent Background Investigation and obtain required Government Security clearance
 * 7+ years of experience in business analysis, systems analysis, and/or design of information systems programs and related business processes
 * Experience working with phase-based and Agile delivery methods
 * Experience with Jira or other Agile tools
 * Ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical users
 * Must be able to work well both in a team environment and independently
 * Must possess exceptional attention to detail
 * Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
 * Familiarity with government projects and policy/procedures teams
 * Demonstrates ability to interact comfortably with Senior Leadership and/or Government Executives and staff on a day-to-day basis
 * Experience in managing client requirements and small teams
 * Excellent analytical skills and business presentation skills
   
   
   

Ideally, you will also have:


 * Experience supporting DHS HQ or other US Federal Agencies
 * Experience tracking and reporting project or program delivery progress and budget execution
 * Experience developing project briefs and reports for non-technical audiences
 * Knowledge of the federal acquisition lifecycle
 * Familiarity with Business Intelligence and Data Analytics
 * Project Management, Agile, and/or Cyber Certifications (PMP / ACP / CSM / SAFe / CISM)
   
   
   

Our Commitment:

Contact Government Services (CGS) strives to simplify and enhance government bureaucracy through the optimization of human, technical, and financial resources. We combine cutting-edge technology with world-class personnel to deliver customized solutions that fit our client’s specific needs. We are committed to solving the most challenging and dynamic problems.

For the past seven years, we’ve been growing our government contracting portfolio, and along the way, we’ve created valuable partnerships by demonstrating a commitment to honesty, professionalism, and quality work.

Here at CGS we value honesty through hard work and self-awareness, professionalism in all we do, and to deliver the best quality to our consumers mending those relations for years to come.

We care about our employees. Therefore, we offer a comprehensive benefits package.


 * Health, Dental, and Vision
 * Life Insurance
 * 401k
 * Flexible Spending Account (Health, Dependent Care, and Commuter)
 * Paid Time Off and Observance of State/Federal Holidays
   
   
   

Contact Government Services, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will be considered without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Join our team and become part of government innovation!

Explore additional job opportunities with CGS on our Job Board:

https://cgsfederal.com/join-our-team/

For more information about CGS please visit: https://www.cgsfederal.com or contact:

Email: info@cgsfederal.com

title: Business Operations Analyst, Global Customer Experience
description:
Why PlayStation?

PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.

PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.

The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.

Business Operations Analyst – Global CX

San Mateo, CA

PlayStation is for everyone. Consumer Experience (CX) provides global services, including outstanding post purchase customer care, hardware services, and online platform safety. Our focus is to build and retain brand loyalty by representing the extraordinary entertainment ecosystem on PlayStation!

We are looking for a hard-working Business Analyst who can support and lead global contract administration, compliance and financial management. As a team member within CX, you will collaborate with business collaborators, legal counsels, vendor partners and finance partners globally!

This role is based in San Mateo, CA.

Business Analyst Responsibilities:


 * Manage all contractual agreements globally.
 * Ensure compliance with legal, regulatory, and organizational policies in all contracts.
 * Maintain a detailed contract management system, ensuring timely renewals, amendments, and terminations.
 * Collaborate with legal counsel to address and resolve any contractual disputes or issues.
 * Monitor contract performance and ensure all parties fulfill their contractual obligations.
 * Assist the lead with financial planning, budgeting, forecasting, and reporting processes.
 * Prepare accurate and timely financial reporting for executive presentations.
 * Conduct financial analysis to identify trends, variances, and opportunities for cost savings and revenue enhancement including quarterly return on investments, actuals and forecast reporting.
 * Manage accounts payable and receivable, ensuring timely creation of purchase orders, invoicing, collections, and payments.
 * Work closely with various departments to ensure alignment of financial and contractual activities with organizational goals.
 * Provide financial and contractual insights to support business development, operations, and pivotal initiatives.
 * Maintain strong relationships with key partners within Consumer Experience and other internal teams and external 3rd parties
   
   

Business Analyst Skills:


 * 5+ years consistent track record as an analyst in handling high profile global contracts and large budgets
 * Bachelor’s or Associate degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or a related field.
 * Strong understanding of contract administration, financial principles, compliance and accounting standards.
 * Excellent analytical, and problem-solving skills.
 * Proficiency in financial software and contract management systems.
 * Exceptional attention to detail and organizational skills.
 * Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
 * Ability to manage several priorities and meet timeline.
 * Ability to work effectively and professionally with cross-functional teams worldwide and with senior partners
 * Ability to multitask and context switch and work efficiently on low level detail
 * Self-motivated and highly organized
   
   

Please refer to our Candidate Privacy Notice for more information about how we process your personal information, and your data protection rights.

At SIE, we consider several factors when setting each role’s base pay range, including the competitive benchmarking data for the market and geographic location.

Please note that the base pay range may vary in line with our hybrid working policy and individual base pay will be determined based on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, and location.

In addition, this role is eligible for SIE’s top-tier benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, matching 401(k), paid time off, wellness program and coveted employee discounts for Sony products. This role also may be eligible for a bonus package. Click here to learn more.

The estimated base pay range for this role is listed below.

$92,100—$138,100 USD

Equal Opportunity Statement:

Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy, maternity or parental status, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category.

We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond.

description:

CGS is looking for business analysts to work with a large federal agency! As a Business Analyst in Business operations and Content Strategy for CGS, you will partner with internal business owners and external partners to understand new business opportunities and define functional requirements.

CGS brings motivated, highly skilled, and creative people together to solve the government’s most dynamic problems with cutting-edge technology.  * Perform risk management, including identifying, prioritizing, and mitigating risks, and communicating and escalating risks and issues

Qualifications:

 * 7+ years of experience in business analysis, systems analysis, and/or design of information systems programs and related business processes

 * Experience in managing client requirements and small teams
 * Excellent analytical skills and business presentation skills
   
   
   

Ideally, you will also have:


 * Experience supporting DHS HQ or other US Federal Agencies
 * Experience tracking and reporting project or program delivery progress and budget execution
 * Experience developing project briefs and reports for non-technical audiences
 * Knowledge of the federal acquisition lifecycle
 * Familiarity with Business Intelligence and Data Analytics

title: Remote Work - Need Business Analyst
description:
100% remote

Need valid LinkedIn

Looking For a Junior Candidate With 3-5 Years’ Experience

Top 3 skills: Strong Business Analysis, Knowledge of Investment Trade Workflows & Clearance & Settlement Cycle, Excellent written and oral communications, MS Office Suite, SQL (only running standard procedures, not writing SQL statements)

They are looking for a junior candidate with 3-5 years’ experience who understands investor trade workflows and the clearance and settlement cycle. They have 2 implementations under way, and this person would learn the software (TBA Mortgage Master) from the ground up and be the point person for these implementations (the buffer to the Managing Partner) and handle all communications and issues with the end client. The Managing Director will train on the software, train on the 5 standard procedures in SQL (need to know SQL, not write SQL statements) and train on their MS Services such as reviewing Trade workflows that are sent in XML or Excel format and determining where there was an error in uploading their trade and attempting to correct it. The managing partner will be a wealth of knowledge to this person and prepare them for the day-to-day workflow and implementation questions. They must be an excellent communicator both written and oral.

Notes

Jr. Resource (not tech heavy) – 3-5 years of exp

They will be working on an implementation

3 years of understanding trade flows (clearance and settlements) – just need a foundation

SQL, XML (files that are coming in that are going through MS Services), MS Services

Responsibilities


 * Learn end-to-end processing of TBA Mortgage Master
 * Participate in implementation meetings
 * Document customer requests and perform business analysis
 * Train business users on TBA Mortgage Master
 * Test workflows and provide feedback
 * Troubleshoot and resolve product issues and concerns
 * Participate in and maintain a knowledge base of the product and infrastructure
   
   

Qualifications


 * Minimum 3 years experience in investment trade operations workflows and clearance and settlement cycle
 * U.S. MBS securities knowledge highly desirable not mandatory
 * Prefer investment management operations vs. broker/dealer operations experience.
 * Ability to build rapport with clients
 * Ability to prioritize and multitask
 * Positive and professional demeanor
 * Excellent written and verbal communication skills
   
   

Systems Knowledge: SQL, Microsoft services, XML, Outlook, Excel, Word

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
Job Title- Senior Business Analyst - Data Governance and Data Management Specialist

Location: 100% Remote

Job Type: Contract / Fulltime both

Must Have

Certifications such as Certified Data Management Professional (CDMP) or similar.

Experience in consulting or client-facing roles within technology sectors.

Excellent Communications Skills

Remote

Role Summary: We are seeking a seasoned Senior Business Analyst who will not only lead our Data Governance and Data Management initiatives but also serve as a key client partner. This role requires a strategic thinker with a deep understanding of data governance and data management frameworks and hands-on experience in implementing these programs effectively.

Key Responsibilities

Lead the planning and implementation of data governance strategies to ensure data accuracy, accessibility, consistency, and security across client organizations.

Act as a bridge between business and IT to develop and maintain strong client relationships, ensuring that data governance and data management initiatives align with client business goals.

Conduct thorough needs analysis, data quality audits, and impact assessments to identify critical governance needs.

Develop comprehensive data management standards, policies, and procedures.

Train and mentor client teams on data governance practices, fostering a data-driven culture.

Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure compliance with relevant data protection regulations and standards.

Provide regular reports and insights to stakeholders on the status, progress, and outcomes of data governance initiatives.

Required Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Information Technology, Data Science, Business Administration, or a related field.

At least 7 years of experience in a business analyst role with a focus on data governance and data management concepts such as MDM, lakehouses etc.

Proven track record of successful implementation of data governance programs and frameworks.

Strong analytical skills and the ability to work with large data sets to assess and formulate strategic directives.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to act as a liaison between clients and technical teams.

Experience with data management tools and technologies.

title: Business Analyst
description:
Who we are:

Allwyn is a multi-national lottery operator with leading market positions in Austria, the Czech Republic, Greece, Cyprus, Italy, the United Kingdom, and the United States. Our primary focus is lotteries, helping them raise more for good causes. We drive innovation, efficiency, and safety across our casual gaming entertainment platform in the quest for enhanced player engagement.

Allwyn North America is headquartered in Chicago. It currently operates the Illinois Lottery under a private management agreement while seeking other opportunities throughout the U.S. We also provide products and services to lotteries and their players throughout Europe and the United States.

About the Team:

The Technology team utilizes the latest technological trends to effectively build and manage solutions in an informal, open, collaborative, and fast-paced environment.

Position Overview:

Within Allwyn North America, the Business Analyst will be responsible for performing business process and software requirements analysis.

Responsibilities:


 * Prepare requirements to plan, and manage the overall requirements phase, including stakeholders and third-party suppliers
 * Perform business process and software requirements analysis on large and commercially important projects
 * Perform research and analysis and provide subject matter expertise on technology trends for key capabilities
 * Analyze products, suppliers, and competitors, and advise on which actions to take
 * Possess a variety of analysis techniques that can be adapted to suit different projects and customers
 * Define the logical architecture for large product development and implementations
 * Independently coordinate and facilitate business information discussions with internal and external stakeholders
 * Consult and advise Allwyn Illinois on a variety of internal and external business systems-related topics
 * Identify business opportunities and product features for Allwyn Illinois's products, and work with a development team to deliver feature-rich solutions.
 * Independently analyze and craft execution plans to delegate problems, issues, and escalations
 * Ensure all governance documents about the requirements phase are in place
 * Support audits as needed
 * Supplier management and oversight as needed
 * Work directly with different workstream leaders to drive the successful completion of efforts
 * Contribute towards business analysis process improvements
   
   
   

Requirements


 * Proven experience as a Business Analyst or similar role
 * Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or related field
 * Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
 * A proven background in working on software development projects in a requirements analysis role
 * Knowledge and experience with core technology and infrastructure capabilities (Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), application development and management, and innovation
 * Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams
 * Strong facilitation skills and management of a variety of stakeholders (third-party suppliers, business stakeholders)
 * Ability to take a project from inception (idea stage) to detailed requirements and organize a plan to deliver the final working solution.
 * Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, and manage several deliverables simultaneously with stakeholders. Proactive and results-oriented is a must
 * Ability to articulate examples of large multiple system implementation projects in a customer environment
 * Experience in working on multiple and varied projects, delivering a variety of software applications, with lottery or gaming experience being an advantage
 * Proficient understanding of software/application architecture and design
 * Excellent written and verbal communication skills
 * Experience in the lottery or gaming industry is a plus
 * Proficiency in business analysis tools and techniques
 * Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
   
   
   

Benefits

Working for Allwyn North America:

Our goal is to create one of North America's most inclusive organizations - where people can bring the best of themselves, to do their best work, every day, for the benefit of good causes. While the main contribution of the Lottery to society is through the funds to good causes, at Allwyn we put our purpose and values at the heart of everything we do. That's why we have committed to an ambitious Social Value strategy, which is woven into the way we do business. We believe that lotteries must serve everyone, not just those who play. So, whether as an employee, a supplier, a retailer or any of the stakeholders that we interact with, we will be powering good across the US.

Moreover, we pledge to have the highest standards of respect, diversity and inclusion at our company and support and encourage our partners to do the same.

Allwyn North America is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

Working for Allwyn North America:

Our goal is to create one of North America's most inclusive organizations - where people can bring the best of themselves, to do their best work, everyday, for the benefit of good causes. While the main contribution of the Lottery to society is through the funds to good causes, at Allwyn we put our purpose and values at the heart of everything we do. That's why we have committed to an ambitious Social Value strategy, which is woven into the way we do business. We believe that lotteries must serve everyone, not just those who play. So, whether as an employee, a supplier, a retailer or any of the stakeholders that we interact with, we will be powering good across the US.

The Allwyn values of We Do What is Right, We Win Together and We Think Differently, are embedded in the design of our organization and our plans for North America.


 * We Do What is Right: By acting with integrity, making brave decisions, taking accountability, and accepting responsibility.
 * We Win Together: By working together as one team, always empowering our colleagues, valuing our differences, and respecting each other. We are always seeking opportunities to create business value while enjoying our work and having fun together
 * We Think Differently: By accepting feedback, listening to our peers, striving for improvement and always daring to innovate. We always deliver with passion and have broad horizons
   
   

Moreover, we pledge to have the highest standards of respect, diversity and inclusion at our company and support and encourage our partners to do the same.

Allwyn North America is an equal-opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
