title: Business Analyst
description:
Job Title: Business Analyst 
Location: Hybrid Schedule, Charlotte NC 
Duration: 6 Month Contract to Start+ Extension 
 
Job Summary:

 * The Business Analyst is focused on the multi-year implementation of an ERP system upgrade across the organization.
 * The Business Analyst is responsible for working within the C Sectors to gather and document business requirements for developing and implementing the ERP upgrade. The position is hybrid and based in Charlotte, NC.

Job Responsibilities:
 * Work directly with business team members, third-party technology vendors, developers, and user community to identify business needs to manage, coordinate, and drive business requirements gathering.
 * Learn a complex business and facilitate projects and decisions across disparate user groups.
 * Work with the client's Sector teams to thoroughly assess and analyze business functions and processes to define, document, and articulate the current business processes.
 * Work on backlog grooming and collaborate with other analysts, developers, and the Product Owner to ensure the backlog is populated with the granular stories needed for development.
 * Create and maintain Business Process Design documentation.
 * Analyze and design the To-Be business processes in partnership with function resources.
 * Ensure solutions meet business needs and requirements.
 * Utilize the understanding of both business processes and technology to work with the client's Technology and external consultants to implement the requirements in the application.
 * Establish meeting cadences, structure, and timelines.
 * Support product managers/owners with the decision-making process.
 * Monitor deliverables and ensure timely completion as part of the overall project.
 * Post-implementation management of feedback and requirements.
 * Write and execute test scripts and coordinate with other analysts for system integration testing.
 * Evaluate system deliverables to ensure they are defect-free and meet the department's quality standards.

 Job Qualifications:

 * Bachelor's degree preferred.
 * 4+ years of Business Analysis experience preferred, ideally in a software development or product enhancement space.
 * Experience with SAP, specifically FI, SD, MM, IM, EWM, AM, AP, AR, CO or PCA modules; S/4 HANA experience a plus
 * 1+ years of project experience using the Agile Methodology is desired.
 * Strong communication skills and ability to work with cross-functional teams.
 * Highly developed sense of ownership, responsibility, and commitment to quality.
 * Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
 * Thorough and highly organized
 * Ability to develop strong working relationships, influence stakeholders, and partner with others to determine acceptable solutions.
 * Ability to prioritize and manage multiple deliverables in a tight deadline-driven environment and adjust to changing priorities.
 * Proficient in Microsoft Office Programs
 * Willing to travel if needed to engage with the client (less than 5%)

 
Our benefits package includes: 
Comprehensive medical benefits

401(k) retirement plan

title: Business Analyst
description:
About The Role




The Business Analyst will be responsible for assessing companies and coming up with solutions to company operations. Business Analysts will work as part of a Pyrovio consulting team. Involves travel to/from various project-related functions approximately 10% of the time.

Support other team members in providing key deliverables to the client

title: Business Analyst
description:
Employment Type: Full-Time, Experienced

Department: Information Technology

CGS is looking for business analysts to work with a large federal agency! As a Business Analyst in Business operations and Content Strategy for CGS, you will partner with internal business owners and external partners to understand new business opportunities and define functional requirements.

CGS brings motivated, highly skilled, and creative people together to solve the government’s most dynamic problems with cutting-edge technology. To carry out our mission, we are seeking candidates who are excited to contribute to government innovation, appreciate collaboration, and can anticipate the needs of others. Here at CGS, we offer an environment in which our employees feel supported, and we encourage professional growth through various learning opportunities.

Skills and attributes for success:


 * Support the development of briefings, agendas, and other general documentation support as directed, including training material and demonstration sessions for new and existing technologies to various stakeholders
 * Document and analyze business and functional requirements so that they may be accurately translated into process maps and technical system requirements
 * Develop comprehensive documentation that meets organizational standards, to include but not limited to basic system architectural diagrams/wireframes, concepts of operations, monthly status reports
 * Create high-level briefings and communications materials for customers, management, and executive stakeholders
 * Work with the government and team members to identify, recommend, and implement opportunities for service delivery improvement and new technology implementation
 * Evaluate program materials and develop innovative approaches for improvement
 * Independently gather information from subject matter experts to develop, organize, and write procedure manuals, technical specifications, and process documentation
 * Develop and implement a deep understanding of Microsoft and Atlassian products and services (Teams, SharePoint, Visio, Jira, Confluence) to translate complex product information into simple, polished, and engaging content
 * Research, outline, write, and edit new and existing content, working closely with various team members to understand project requirements
 * Develop content in various media forms for maximum usability, with a consistent and cohesive voice across all documentation
 * Perform risk management, including identifying, prioritizing, and mitigating risks, and communicating and escalating risks and issues
 * Support a continuous improvement process by providing recommendations on improving products, services, and processes
 * Manage client interaction and expectations regarding team efforts
 * Identify and coordinate cross-team dependencies and collaboration
 * Continually seek opportunities to increase customer satisfaction, develop and deepen long-lasting client relationships
   
   
   

Qualifications:


 * Must be a U.S. Citizen
 * Bachelor's Degree (Computer Science, or engineering)
 * Must be able to successfully complete a stringent Background Investigation and obtain required Government Security clearance
 * 7+ years of experience in business analysis, systems analysis, and/or design of information systems programs and related business processes
 * Experience working with phase-based and Agile delivery methods
 * Experience with Jira or other Agile tools
 * Ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical users
 * Must be able to work well both in a team environment and independently
 * Must possess exceptional attention to detail
 * Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
 * Familiarity with government projects and policy/procedures teams
 * Demonstrates ability to interact comfortably with Senior Leadership and/or Government Executives and staff on a day-to-day basis
 * Experience in managing client requirements and small teams
 * Excellent analytical skills and business presentation skills
   
   
   

Ideally, you will also have:


 * Experience supporting DHS HQ or other US Federal Agencies
 * Experience tracking and reporting project or program delivery progress and budget execution
 * Experience developing project briefs and reports for non-technical audiences
 * Knowledge of the federal acquisition lifecycle
 * Familiarity with Business Intelligence and Data Analytics
 * Project Management, Agile, and/or Cyber Certifications (PMP / ACP / CSM / SAFe / CISM)
   
   
   

Our Commitment:

Contact Government Services (CGS) strives to simplify and enhance government bureaucracy through the optimization of human, technical, and financial resources. We combine cutting-edge technology with world-class personnel to deliver customized solutions that fit our client’s specific needs. We are committed to solving the most challenging and dynamic problems.

For the past seven years, we’ve been growing our government contracting portfolio, and along the way, we’ve created valuable partnerships by demonstrating a commitment to honesty, professionalism, and quality work.

Here at CGS we value honesty through hard work and self-awareness, professionalism in all we do, and to deliver the best quality to our consumers mending those relations for years to come.

We care about our employees. Therefore, we offer a comprehensive benefits package.


 * Health, Dental, and Vision
 * Life Insurance
 * 401k
 * Flexible Spending Account (Health, Dependent Care, and Commuter)
 * Paid Time Off and Observance of State/Federal Holidays
   
   
   

Contact Government Services, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will be considered without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Join our team and become part of government innovation!

Explore additional job opportunities with CGS on our Job Board:

https://cgsfederal.com/join-our-team/

For more information about CGS please visit: https://www.cgsfederal.com or contact:

Email: info@cgsfederal.com

title: Business Intake Analyst
description:
ABOUT JENNER & BLOCK

Jenner & Block (www.jenner.com) is a law firm with global reach, with more than 500 lawyers and offices in Chicago, London, Los Angeles, New York, San Francisco and Washington, DC. The firm is known for its prominent and successful litigation practice and experience handling sophisticated and high-profile corporate transactions. Firm clients include Fortune 100 companies, large privately held corporations, financial services institutions, emerging companies and venture capital and private equity investors. The American Lawyer magazine has ranked Jenner & Block as the #1 pro bono firm in the United States 10 times, most recently in 2019. The firm has been ranked in the top 10 in this category every year since 1990.




OVERVIEW

Jenner & Block is seeking an innovative, meticulous, motivated individual for the Business Intake Analyst role. This is an exciting opportunity to join Jenner & Block, where our foundation is one of shared values: a commitment to integrity and professionalism, an eye towards a brighter future, and a tireless pursuit of justice. We have built a supportive and inclusive culture, where front-runners in our field—lawyers and professional staff, alike—can think and act with bold determination – “Our people are the heart of Jenner & Block.” The Business Intake Analyst will be responsible for reviewing, modifying, and processing new client, new matter, revision, and other related requests and processes using the Firm's automated business intake system. Using well-established standards, business rules, processes, and policies as guidance, the Business Intake Analyst will act as the primary point of contact for all new requests.




This position interfaces with all members of the Conflicts and Business Intake team, as well as firm management, lawyers, and legal assistants. The ideal candidate will be self-motivated and have a collaborative mindset, effective communication, critical thinking, practical judgment and decision-making skills, and the ability to provide creative ideas for process improvements. Conflicts and Customer Service experience is preferred. The Business Intake Analyst primary responsibilities are as follows:




 * Assist with processing new client and new matter requests and amending requests for clarity, completeness, and additional parties when needed.
 * Responsible for follow-up and processing of all intake requests pending action by an approver, submitter, or submitting lawyer to ensure compliance.
 * Respond to inquiries from the Office of General Counsel, Risk Management leadership and attorneys with accurate information in a timely and professional matter.
 * Assist with large data clean-up projects, special report requests, and responses to unique and complex client and matter information requests from a variety of customers.
 * Coordinate the monitoring and updating of materials as needed for support documents.
 * Serve as a technical liaison - monitor end-user errors and technical problems.
 * Act as a training liaison - provide training/orientation sessions as subject matter expert as new and existing employees.
 * Assist with the review/indexing of Firmwide client retention agreements.
 * Contribute to process, procedure, and technology improvements in order to reduce risk and improve efficiency.




Jenner & Block offers a comprehensive benefits program, which includes medical, dental, and vision insurance, 401(k), and paid time off, in addition to other offerings.




Jenner & Block LLP is an equal opportunity employer. Recruitment and employment decisions are not made on the basis of an individual’s race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability or medical condition, genetic information, sexual orientation, sex, gender identity and/or expression, pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding or related medical conditions, arrest record, matriculation, personal appearance, political affiliation, marital, parental, veteran, military, or order of protection status, or any other protected status or that of their relatives, friends, or associates.

title: Business Analyst
description:
Responsibilities

Kforce has a client in Dayton, OH that is seeking a Business Analyst for a 6-12 month contract role. This role can be remote, East Coast hours. Summary: We are seeking a highly motivated and inquisitive Business Analyst to join our team on a 6-12-month contract. This role is pivotal in bridging the gap between business and IT, ensuring that complex technical information is effectively communicated to non-technical stakeholders. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to work on a variety of projects ranging from quick fixes to larger capability-building initiatives. Responsibilities:


 * * Analyze and Solve Problems: Identify and understand business problems, and develop solutions to address them
 * * Bridge Business and IT: Translate complex technical information into clear, non-technical terms for business stakeholders
 * * Project Management: Manage and deliver on various projects, including creating health savings calculators and upgrading intelligence systems
 * * Stakeholder Engagement: Work closely with business teams to extract and understand their needs and requirements
 * * Agile Methodology: Operate within an agile or hybrid delivery organization to ensure timely and efficient project completion
   
   

Requirements


 * 3-5 years of experience
 * Naturally curious and inquisitive
 * Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities
 * Above average oral and written presentation skills
 * Solid negotiation skills
 * Experience with Electronic Visit Verification (EVV) is a plus
 * Healthcare background preferred but not required
 * Experience in an agile or hybrid delivery organization
   
   

Preferred Qualifications


 * A natural inclination to dig deep and keep investigating until the problem is solved
 * Ability to sit with business stakeholders and extract necessary information
 * Act as a bridge between the technical and business teams
 * Enjoy the flexibility of working remotely while adhering to East Coast hours
 * Be part of significant projects that will shape our operations in 2025 and beyond
 * Work in a dynamic and supportive team that values your input and expertise
 * Extra bonus points for experience with Long-Term Services and Supports (LTSS)
   
   

The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

title: Business Analyst
description:
INTRODUCTION




Creative Co-Op, Inc. (www.creativecoop.com) is a leading importer and distributor of gift and home decorative accessories. We work with over 15,000 boutique specialty stores in North America, Fortune 500 national retailers and major eCommerce partners. Headquartered in Memphis, TN the company has hundreds of employees globally with offices and showrooms in Portland, Atlanta, Dallas, Las Vegas, and China.




Creative Co-Op is the cornerstone division of Regent Holding Company whose global brands also include Illume (www.illumecandles.com) based in Minneapolis, MN and Bloomingville (www.bloomingville.com) based in Ikast, Demark. Regent’s growth is backed by Freeman Spogli & Co. (www.freemanspogli.com), a leading private equity firm dedicated to investing in the consumer and distribution sectors.




We are looking for dedicated, high energy creative individuals who want to join an industry leader undergoing rapid growth and expansion. We look for people who embody an entrepreneurial spirit and are drawn to our Core Values:




· Think First – We validate gut instincts with facts.

· Act The Right Way – Our integrity has been built over decades and can be lost in seconds.

· Care About More Than Yourself – We are passionate. We show that passion through fierce commitment to our customers and colleagues.

· Embrace Evolution – We are hungry for improvement and never satisfied with the status quo.




Job Definition:

The Business Analyst serves as a critical liaison between business units and the IT department. This role involves collaborating with stakeholders across the organization and external partners to define, document, and refine business processes and software requirements. By conducting thorough analyses of current operations, the Business Analyst identifies opportunities for process improvement and technology enhancements. This includes, but is not limited to, ERP systems, warehouse management systems (WMS) solutions, online platforms, and other enterprise information systems. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical skills, exceptional communication abilities, and a keen understanding of business operations.




Primary Responsibilities:




 * Conduct in-depth analysis of business processes to identify inefficiencies and areas for optimization.
 * Elicit, document, and validate business requirements through various techniques (interviews, workshops, document analysis).
 * Develop comprehensive business requirements documentation, including process flow diagrams, data models, and user stories.
 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment of technology solutions with business objectives.
 * Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their needs and gather detailed business requirements.
 * Communicate findings, recommendations, and project updates to stakeholders and executives.
 * Conduct feasibility studies and cost-benefit analyses to support decision-making.
 * Participate in project planning, estimating, and resource allocation.
 * Assess the feasibility and impact of proposed solutions, ensuring alignment with business goals and project timelines.
 * Oversee the implementation of new systems and processes, providing ongoing support and training to end-users.
 * Monitor project progress, identify potential risks, and develop mitigation plans.




Knowledge, Skills, Abilities Required:




Education: Bachelor’s Degree.

Experience: 5+ years of previous business analyst experience.

Skills:

 * Identifying issues, evaluating options, and developing effective solutions.
 * Effectively conveying complex information to both technical and non-technical audiences.
 * Eliciting, documenting, and validating business needs.
 * Interpreting data to identify trends and patterns.
 * Creating clear and concise documentation (e.g., business requirements, process flows).
 * MS Office Suite and BI Tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Tableau, Power BI).
 * Understanding of database structures (SQL).
 * Basic understanding of project management methodologies

title: DGS - Business Analyst 4
description:
The Virginia Dept. of General Services (DGS), Division of Engineering and Building (DEB), is looking for a Business Analyst with process improvement experience to assist with its Building Information Tracking System(BITS) Modernization efforts.

This position is primarily responsible for business analysis, process improvement, and requirements documentation of DEB business processes that will inform the design and development of systems for BITS Modernization efforts. The selected candidate in this position will work closely with stakeholders, DEB Subject Matter Experts (SMEs), DEB Agency customers(“Agencies”), and DGS, Information Systems and Services (ISS), development teams. The Business Analyst will report to the Business Owner to ensure business requirements, enhancements, modifications, and newly identified business initiatives are thoroughly documented for successful implementation of Information Technology solution(s). This position should expect to work between30 and 40 hours per week.

Required Experience, Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities


 * Experience in system design and development, with a focus on process improvement and business and technical requirements gathering
 * Experience workflow processes
 * Experience developing test plans, use cases, and performing quality assurance validation, user acceptance testing, and regression testing
 * Experience in the development of training materials and conducting user training
 * Strong interpersonal and communication skills –The successful candidate should be a self-starter with the ability to drive the analysis effort
   
   

Preferred Experience


 * Knowledge of building and construction management systems – including compliance, budgeting, and permitting workflows and practices.
 * Project admin experience in commercial/institutional construction.
 * Knowledge of public construction project terminologies, permitting, and procurement standards.
 * IT application/systems development and/or management experience.
 * Ability to manage small to moderate scope projects.
   
   

Specific Tasks May Include


 * Working with customer SMEs and project team to develop business requirements in response to requests for systems enhancements, modifications, and newly identified business initiatives.
 * Driving engagement by facilitating SME interviews and work sessions, project conference calls/meetings, status reporting, planning sessions, and providing for meeting notes.
 * Proactively making suggestions for systems and process improvement performing problem and opportunity analysis, early complexity assessment, and capturing results in the form of a business case to propose new change initiatives.
 * Evaluating alternative strategies and making recommendations for viable process solutions that are compatible with current technologies and systems.
 * Working with ISS technical team and vendors to ensure requirements are incorporated into systems design and testing.
 * Developing business requirements documentation and flow diagrams – this work may expand into technical requirements gathering, design, and systems documentation.
 * Actively participating in functional and systems integration unit testing; creating use case scenarios, test plans, and testing results.
 * Assisting with testing
 * Developing and presenting training to DEB and agency users
 * Providing implementation and maintenance support
 * Meeting regularly with customer and project teams and regularly demonstrating quality work output.
 * Keeping the Business Owner and ISS technical team informed of key issues that may impact project implementation.
 * Utilizing project management applications, collaboration applications, and MS Office applications; Visio, SharePoint, MS Teams, screen and video capture software, and other applications as needed.
   
   

Please note we are looking for a self-motivated and proactive Business Analyst who is detail oriented, willing to question the status quo, propose improvements, and not necessarily a blended PM.

title: Business Analyst
description:
We are seeking a Business Analyst for one of our clients, 7700 Midlothian Turnpike North Chesterfield, VA

Please share the updated resume to venkat@dizercorp.com

Job Title: Business Analyst

Location: 7700 Midlothian Turnpike North Chesterfield, VA

Duration: 10+ months

Work Arrangement: Onsite

Interview Type : In Person Only

About The Role

Virginia State Police (VSP) is looking for a Senior Business Systems Analyst with 6+years of experience to lead projects related to computerized document creation, workflows, interfaces and storage for criminal and civil systems including the Criminal and Rap Back Information System (CRIS) project. The incumbent will perform complex business analysis and technical tasks such as project planning, process improvement, writing requirements, system design, data analysis, interface analysis, and system rollout. The incumbent will serve as the Team Leader for a document management team and lead DocuSign eSignature forms, workflows, interfaces and JavaScript development. These duties involve the following: Leads the overall review, analysis and evaluation of current business systems; analyzes, recommends and implements process improvements; creates and evaluates user requirements and system needs; elicits requirements using various elicitation techniques such as Brainstorming, Data Mining, Document Analysis, and Interviews with users; produces requirements artifacts such as Field Definition Matrix, Business Rules, Interface requirements; performs gap analysis on existing requirements in conjunction with current business needs; contributes to and drives a collaborative effort to support organizational change management; facilitates risk analysis; participates in the creation and subsequent reviews of project test plans; leads all final user acceptance efforts with business stakeholders; defines roles and access rights needed for applications; represents VSP's interests with vendors and collaborates with them to help meet project needs; creates training materials and provides end-user training. Candidates for this position are required to have experience developing DocuSign eSignature forms and workflows, including experience customizing form behaviors using JavaScript. Also, candidates for this position should possess strong leadership skills, strong organization, administrative, analytical, problem solving and interpersonal skills; be self-motivated and able to develop rapport and positive working relationships with coworkers and the agency at large; be proficient in Organizational Change Management; have prior experience implementing cloud-hosted Software As A Service (SaaS) solutions; have an understanding of business analysis concepts such as identifying and interpreting risk assessments; be able to produce requirement related artifacts such as test cases, requirements traceability matrix, business rules, interface requirements, use cases, activity diagrams, error validations and role based system profiles; be able to manage security access and user profile management; be able to work collaboratively with various groups within VSP and VSP vendors to ensure requirements are vetted and documented; be able to analyze functional/nonfunctional system requirements; be able to re-engineer business processes; be able to identify how new applications and business processes will integrate with or replace existing business processes; possess excellent communication skills in English and the ability to communicate with internal customers in nontechnical terms; be proficient with Microsoft Products (Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint); be proficient in creating business and system requirements. Candidates should highlight any experience working on criminal justice projects. The incumbent must work full-time onsite at VSP headquarters, North Chesterfield.

Regards,

Venkatesh Simhadri

Sr.Recruiter

Direct: 216-452-9196

E-mail: venkat@dizercorp.com

title: Business Analyst, Amazon Fresh Grocery
description:
Description

The Amazon Fresh Grocery team is looking for a Business Analyst (BA) to support business reporting/data needs (e.g., weekly performance reporting, selection management, cost improvements, promotion optimization, etc.) while developing scalable solutions for the future. A successful BA delivers results at both strategic and tactical levels, carefully balances speed and depth, influences decision making, and impacts multiple parts of the business.

Business Analysts think deeply about the data and information needed to support growth, reduce costs, and improve efficiency, and provide clear recommendations and/or modeling to support their conclusions. They identify opportunities and drive improvements through data fueled solutions, and leverage stakeholder input and feedback to develop roadmaps and set expectations.

The ideal candidate will take a customer centric approach when identifying and addressing challenges, having both a business sense and a solid understanding of the technical landscape. You must be able to thrive and succeed in an entrepreneurial environment, and be able to navigate a high level of ambiguity and competing priorities. High judgment, speed, ability to influence, analytical capability, and exceptional communication are essential to succeed in this role.

Key job responsibilities


 * Own, influence, and improve existing shared, business critical reporting such as the Weekly Business Review.
 * Solicit the team for reporting needs, areas of opportunity, dashboard requests, and cost reduction opportunities.
 * Play an active business role by proactively identifying business, data, measurement, etc., needs.
 * Create a roadmap mechanism and process that allows you to educate and set expectations with leaders and team members.
 * Deliver on your roadmap, on time, and at a high standard.
 * In coordination with the leaders in the business, develop goals for yourself that balance meeting the needs of the business and your personal growth.
 * Represent Category data needs and drive improvements in org-wide settings.
   
   

Basic Qualifications


 * Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, business, economics, engineering , analytics, mathematics, statistics or a related technical or quantitative field
 * 3+ years of business analyst, data analyst or similar role experience
 * Experience with SQL
 * 3+ years of Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau experience
 * Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
 * Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools
   
   

Preferred Qualifications


 * Experience partnering with executive-level leaders to identifying and solving business issues
 * Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders
 * Experience with providing data to make retail business decisions, including sales, margin, shrink, promotions and inventory data.

title: Business Analyst/ Project Request Analyst
description:
Job Title: KSU - Business Analyst/ Project Request Analyst

Location: 1075 Canton Pl NW, Kennesaw, GA 30144

Duration: 12 MONTHS.

Description

Serves as the liaison between functional and technical teams to evaluate project requests and document the business case for a request.

Four Month Assignment with possible extension based on budget approval.

Telework available


 * The IT Business Analyst will support the IT project request process by performing stakeholder interviews and facilitating workshops to define and understand business functions and processes (current and future state), identify pain-points, inefficiencies, and related functions and processes, elicit and negotiate business requirements for new implementations and modifications to existing IT systems and services, create process diagrams, document use cases, and partner with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to identify and validate solutions to business unit requests and requirements.
   
   

Minimum Education Required


 * Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited institution of higher education in Information Systems or related field or equivalent combination of education and/or experience.
   
   

Minimum Experience Required


 * Four (2) years previous experience in business/systems/process analysis
   
   

MINIMUM LICENSURE/CERTIFICATION REQUIRED BY LAW AND/OR INSTITUTION: None

ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS: (Preferred qualifications)


 * IT Project Management experience
 * Agile Facilitation experience
 * International Institute of Business Analysis (IIBA-CCBA) certification
 * PMI Professional in Business Analysis (PMI-PBA)
   
   

Key Responsibilities


 * Schedule, prepare, and facilitate fact finding/discovery analysis meetings with stakeholders and subject matter experts to understand and document current business processes and functions, pain points, assumptions, timeframes, and success measures
 * Present business process documentation to business and IT decision makers for approval
 * Define business process inputs, outputs, and data elements required for optimal execution
 * Collaborate with business partners to confirm scope and objectives of the project and formulate a shared understanding of project priorities
 * Assist with identifying scope creep and collaborate with technical and functional teams to evaluate feasibility, effort, and project impact of scope changes
 * Facilitate identification of business-critical process steps and the requirements/policies driving those steps
 * Identify and understand the governing rules and regulations that affect project teams’ business processes
 * Designs user interface mock-ups to effectively meet business needs within native system functionality
 * Document system processes, functionality and recommend improvements as applicable
 * Understand, analyze, and communicate benefits of product features/functionalities to assist customer in evaluating go forward strategies and solutions
 * Collaborate with IT team members and business area representatives to help identify and validate technical solutions to business requests/issues
 * Create standardized templates for internal IT and Business Analyst processes
 * Assists with devising test plans and coordinating User Acceptance Testing documents
 * Plans and executes unit integration and acceptance testing to validate individual customer requirements against delivered product
 * Contributes to and maintains an issues log and collaborates with appropriate teams to identify and mitigate risks

title: Business Analyst
description:
Employment Type: Full-Time, Experienced

Department: Information Technology

CGS is looking for business analysts to work with a large federal agency! As a Business Analyst in Business operations and Content Strategy for CGS, you will partner with internal business owners and external partners to understand new business opportunities and define functional requirements.

CGS brings motivated, highly skilled, and creative people together to solve the government’s most dynamic problems with cutting-edge technology. To carry out our mission, we are seeking candidates who are excited to contribute to government innovation, appreciate collaboration, and can anticipate the needs of others. Here at CGS, we offer an environment in which our employees feel supported, and we encourage professional growth through various learning opportunities.

Skills and attributes for success:


 * Support the development of briefings, agendas, and other general documentation support as directed, including training material and demonstration sessions for new and existing technologies to various stakeholders
 * Document and analyze business and functional requirements so that they may be accurately translated into process maps and technical system requirements
 * Develop comprehensive documentation that meets organizational standards, to include but not limited to basic system architectural diagrams/wireframes, concepts of operations, monthly status reports
 * Create high-level briefings and communications materials for customers, management, and executive stakeholders
 * Work with the government and team members to identify, recommend, and implement opportunities for service delivery improvement and new technology implementation
 * Evaluate program materials and develop innovative approaches for improvement
 * Independently gather information from subject matter experts to develop, organize, and write procedure manuals, technical specifications, and process documentation
 * Develop and implement a deep understanding of Microsoft and Atlassian products and services (Teams, SharePoint, Visio, Jira, Confluence) to translate complex product information into simple, polished, and engaging content
 * Research, outline, write, and edit new and existing content, working closely with various team members to understand project requirements
 * Develop content in various media forms for maximum usability, with a consistent and cohesive voice across all documentation
 * Perform risk management, including identifying, prioritizing, and mitigating risks, and communicating and escalating risks and issues
 * Support a continuous improvement process by providing recommendations on improving products, services, and processes
 * Manage client interaction and expectations regarding team efforts
 * Identify and coordinate cross-team dependencies and collaboration
 * Continually seek opportunities to increase customer satisfaction, develop and deepen long-lasting client relationships
   
   
   

Qualifications:


 * Must be a U.S. Citizen
 * Bachelor's Degree (Computer Science, or engineering)
 * Must be able to successfully complete a stringent Background Investigation and obtain required Government Security clearance
 * 7+ years of experience in business analysis, systems analysis, and/or design of information systems programs and related business processes
 * Experience working with phase-based and Agile delivery methods
 * Experience with Jira or other Agile tools
 * Ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical users
 * Must be able to work well both in a team environment and independently
 * Must possess exceptional attention to detail
 * Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
 * Familiarity with government projects and policy/procedures teams
 * Demonstrates ability to interact comfortably with Senior Leadership and/or Government Executives and staff on a day-to-day basis
 * Experience in managing client requirements and small teams
 * Excellent analytical skills and business presentation skills
   
   
   

Ideally, you will also have:


 * Experience supporting DHS HQ or other US Federal Agencies
 * Experience tracking and reporting project or program delivery progress and budget execution
 * Experience developing project briefs and reports for non-technical audiences
 * Knowledge of the federal acquisition lifecycle
 * Familiarity with Business Intelligence and Data Analytics
 * Project Management, Agile, and/or Cyber Certifications (PMP / ACP / CSM / SAFe / CISM)
   
   
   

Our Commitment:

Contact Government Services (CGS) strives to simplify and enhance government bureaucracy through the optimization of human, technical, and financial resources. We combine cutting-edge technology with world-class personnel to deliver customized solutions that fit our client’s specific needs. We are committed to solving the most challenging and dynamic problems.

For the past seven years, we’ve been growing our government contracting portfolio, and along the way, we’ve created valuable partnerships by demonstrating a commitment to honesty, professionalism, and quality work.

Here at CGS we value honesty through hard work and self-awareness, professionalism in all we do, and to deliver the best quality to our consumers mending those relations for years to come.

We care about our employees. Therefore, we offer a comprehensive benefits package.


 * Health, Dental, and Vision
 * Life Insurance
 * 401k
 * Flexible Spending Account (Health, Dependent Care, and Commuter)
 * Paid Time Off and Observance of State/Federal Holidays
   
   
   

Contact Government Services, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will be considered without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Join our team and become part of government innovation!

Explore additional job opportunities with CGS on our Job Board:

https://cgsfederal.com/join-our-team/

For more information about CGS please visit: https://www.cgsfederal.com or contact:

Email: info@cgsfederal.com

title: Junior Business Analyst
description:

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
American National is seeking a Senior Business Analyst to support our P&C Underwriting Division in our new corporate office in the heart of downtown Houston. The Senior Business Analyst position is right for you if you have previous Business Analyst experience and are ready to step into large-scale projects while mentoring other Business Analysts on the team. In this role, you will work independently while also enjoying the support of a highly collaborative, cross-functional team!










What Will You Do?

• Elicits, identifies, and documents written business requirements and user acceptance testing criteria for department service requests and projects and collaborates with other business area BAs to assist in doing the same for product or large strategic initiatives.

• Validates requirements match the intention of the stakeholder’s needs, assesses that requirements demonstrate value, and communicates the advantages/disadvantages of alternate solutions when applicable.

• Utilize excellent written and verbal skills to communicate recommended solutions, weighing risks, benefits, and potential value.

• Investigates and uses data analytics to determine how solutions or processes are performing after deployment and recommends improvements to support change management or maximize efficiencies as applicable.

• Identifies alternatives and actions including replacing/retiring/enhancing a solution or adjusting the organization to allow for maximum solution performance and value recognition.

• Serves as a liaison between underwriting and other business areas (such as Computer Technology Services (CTS), product, actuarial, agencies, training, compliance, claims, billing, call center, client experience, etc.) and collaborates effectively.

• Mentors other Business Analysts, assisting in supporting consistent business analysis practices across all projects and lines of business.







Qualifications

• Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field preferred

• Scrum Certification, or Business Analyst designation desired

• Five or more years of industry or business analyst work experience

• Expert knowledge in business analysis and can train others effectively

• Proven ability to creatively approach situations with innovative thinking

• Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with all levels and business areas in the organization

• Possesses effective conflict resolution skills

• Strong technical aptitude, proficient with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint). Experience with SharePoint, Azure DevOps, and Duck Creek is beneficial

• Must be highly organized, self-driven, results-oriented, visionary thinker with a clear focus on quality.










Salary for this position can range from $75,000 for candidates who are minimally qualified through $90,000 for more highly qualified candidates. Candidates outside of the range are encouraged to apply, and will be considered based on experience, skill and education.

title: Business Analyst
description:
The Electronic Trading Engineering team is seeking a Technical Project Manager/ Business Analyst to help build our electronic trading systems for front office investment professionals. This role will partner closely with Traders and Portfolio Managers to understand their workflows, explore ways to improve our execution, find efficiencies, push the boundaries of automation, and enhance controls in a platform that scales across our Asset Management business. A successful candidate will be a proficient project manager who communicates and collaborates effectively, taking ownership and accountability for all assigned aspects of each project.



Responsibilities:

 * Partner closely with Front Office stakeholders, translate their complex business needs into

strategic engineering plans and own the project through completion

 * Work with engineers to develop detailed technical requirements and acceptance criteria from a set of high-level business requirements
 * Proactively communicate, set expectations, stay ahead of roadblocks, and provide status

updates to both technical and non-technical audiences

 * Exercise technical judgment to define projects, develop product roadmaps, and facilitate

prioritization discussions with stakeholders.

 * Provide the intellectual curiosity to continuously innovate towards increased efficiency,

automation and client satisfaction

 * Own solution development across order origination, execution management, algo development, compliance & controls management, market connectivity, trade booking and regulatory reporting.



Requirements:

 * Strong technical and analytical skills
 * Strong written and verbal communication and impeccable organizational skills
 * Experience building detailed project plans (defining project scope, requirements, and timelines, building business cases) using the tools and elements of technical program management.
 * Experience within Order Management System build outs is a plus
 * Experience with front office trading systems and products is a plus

title: Business Analyst
description:
Statement Of Work

The Business Analyst (Contractor) shall have extensive business analysis experience and knowledge with a proven track record in IT Service Management (ITSM) and IT Asset Management (ITAM) implementations to lead requirements elicitation, process optimization, and assist in tool configuration efforts for CalSTRS ITSM/ITAM implementation project in order to meet business objectives.

Minimum Technical Qualifications


 * At least five (5) years of experience within the last ten (10) years working as a Business Analyst with large organizations, leading or participating in the technical implementation of ITSM and ITAM solutions such as ServiceNow automating complex business processes, performing all the following activities:
 * Creating and maintaining requirement management plan
 * Assessment of analysis scope and tasks
 * Planning business analysis tasks
 * Facilitating joint application design (JAD) and/or collaborative design sessions
 * Elicitation, definitions and documentation of various business, user, and system requirements
 * Analysis for business process improvement, application design and workflow automation
 * Modeling and documenting new functional requirements; use case development.
 * Leading and working within cross-functional teams that include business subject matter experts, application architects, developers, and testers.
 * Work closely with the ServiceNow implementation vendor team.
 * At least seven (7) years of experience within the last ten (10) years producing deliverables shown in the following list: (CalSTRS may request deliverable related work samples during Phase 4, Interviews, of the Comparison Process)
 * Business requirements, business rules, and business process model
 * Use cases, functional requirements and/or functional specifications
 * Non-functional requirements
 * Stakeholder requests
 * Procurement documentation
 * Transition plans and/or implementation requirements
 * Traceability matrices
 * At least three (3) years of experience using Rational Requisite Pro, HP ALM, Jama Software, or other requirement gathering tool to document functional and non- functional requirements, design specifications and provide full traceability for projects.
   
   

Desirable Technical Qualifications

It is desirable for the proposed project person to have the following listed experience, knowledge, skills and abilities:


 * Experience as a Business Analyst with the State or Federal government.
 * Experience as a Business Analyst leading or participating in the technical implementation of ITSM and ITAM solutions, such as ServiceNow, including, but not limited to the following areas of focus:
    * Incident Management
    * Change Management
    * Problem Management
    * Configuration Management
    * Hardware Asset Management
    * Software Asset Management
    * Cloud SaaS Cost Management
    * Request Management – Service Catalog
    * End User Experience
    * Service Portfolio
    * Asset Discovery
    * Service Level Management



 * IIBA Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP or CCBA). CalSTRS may request a copy of Certification.
 * Experience in Agile project management methodology or Scaled Agile Framework.
 * Experience in the ITIL Framework.
 * Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Management Information Systems or related fields from an accredited or government-sanctioned college/university. CalSTRS may request a copy of degree.
    * The proposed project person will be able to adhere to the hybrid working model by working on-site 2-3 days per week at CalSTRS Headquarters, West Sacramento, CA. If no, provide a short explanation.

title: Business Analyst
description:
About Us

eSimplicity is a modern digital services company that delivers innovative federal and commercial IT solutions designed to improve the health and lives of millions of Americans while defending our national interests. eSimplicity's people-centric approach aims to transform the American healthcare experience through innovative technologies. Our team’s experience spans various federal civilian customers on diverse projects across its core competencies. We prioritize protecting our community by aiding the government’s cloud migration, prototyping artificial intelligence models to identify fraudulent Medicare claims, and accelerating data report delivery for healthcare providers to improve the quality of care for patients.




A successful Business Analyst will build a strong working knowledge of business and technical requirements that support our products and data. They will also have strong organizational, critical thinking, and communication skills.




You should be analytical and an excellent communicator.




Responsibilities:

 * Under general supervision, formulate and define systems scope and objectives through research and fact-finding, combined with an understanding of applicable business systems and industry requirements.
 * Perform analysis of business and technical needs, documenting requirements and system logic.
 * Work competently in some phases of systems analysis and consider the business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment.
 * Develop and update technical documentation.
 * Support product vision workshops.
 * Work with stakeholders, Product Owners, and agile team members to develop and prioritize concise and testable epics, features, and user stories.




Requirements

Minimum Position Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required:

 * Minimum of 4- 7 years related experience.
 * A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Business, or other related scientific or technical discipline. With ten years of general information technology experience and at least eight years of specialized experience, a degree is not required.
 * Candidate must reside in the United States.
 * Proven experience as a Business Analyst.
 * Proven abilities to be collaborative and take initiative and be innovative.
 * Analytical mind with a problem-solving aptitude.
 * Experience with Agile methodology.
 * Experience with Atlassian Jira/Confluence.
 * Excellent command of written and spoken English.
 * Ability to obtain and maintain a Public Trust; residing in the United States
 * Flexible and willing to accept a change in priorities as necessary.




Desired Qualifications:

 * Federal Government contracting work experience.
 * Experience work with the SAFe methodology.




Working Environment:

eSimplicity supports a remote work environment operating within the Eastern time zone so we can work with and respond to our government clients. Expected hours are 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM Eastern unless otherwise directed by your manager. Occasional travel for training and project meetings. It is estimated to be less than 25% per year.




Benefits:

We offer highly competitive salaries, healthcare benefits, and a flexible leave policy.




Equal Employment Opportunity:

 * eSimplicity is an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender, age, status as a protected veteran, sexual orientation, gender identity, or status as a qualified individual with a disability.

title: Business Analyst - Intermediate
description:
Responsibilities

Kforce has a client in Columbus, OH that is seeking a Business Analyst - Intermediate. Responsibilities:


 * Business Analyst partners with the Product Manager to identify new product opportunities that reflect the needs of our customers and the market through user research and discover
 * Considers and plans for upstream and downstream implications of new product features on the overall product experience
 * Supports the collection of user research, journey mapping, and market analysis to inform the strategic product roadmap and provide insight on potential product features that provide value to customers
 * As a Business Analyst, you will analyze, track, and evaluate product metrics including work to time, cost, and quality targets across the product development life cycle
 * Writes the requirements, epics, and user stories to support product development
   
   

Requirements


 * 3+ years of experience or equivalent expertise in product management or a relevant domain area
 * Proficient knowledge of the product development life cycle
 * Experience in product life cycle activities including discovery and requirements definition
 * Developing knowledge of data analytics and data literacy
   
   

The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

description:

Pay Range: $39.31/hour. Employee benefits include, but are not limited to, health insurance (medical, dental, vision), 401(k) plan, and paid sick leave (depending on work location).

Key Responsibilities:


 * Serve as a point of contact for technical questions from Field Sales and Client Professional customers
 * Perform regression testing and user acceptance testing for applications and business processes
 * Assist product owners with the develop of training content and recommend best practices to end-users
 * Perform day-to-day business processes such as lead conversions, account lifecycle management, and user management
 * Perform technical troubleshooting across multiple platforms and escalate to proper personnel for resolution
   
   

Key Requirements and Technology Experience:


 * Candidate should be technically savvy and possess strong problem-solving skills
 * Candidate must possess a high degree of data management and analysis skills
 * Candidate should be proficient in Microsoft Office applications, especially Excel, Access, and Word
 * Should be self-motivated, solutions-oriented, multi-task capable, and have demonstrated the ability to work well with others in a fast-paced, time-sensitive environment
 * Must possess strong analytical and computer skills, sound organizational and planning skills, excellent verbal and written communication skills, strong interpersonal skills, and a proven ability to make sound business decisions
 * Must be performing satisfactorily in current position
 * Embraces diverse people, thinking and styles
 * Bachelor's degree in relevant field (computer science, information systems, mathematics, statistics, industrial engineering, or a related analytical field)
 * Salesforce certification
 * Certified Scrum Product Owner certification
 * Understanding of AWS cloud technology platform and services
 * Knowledge of Agile development principles
 * General knowledge of Client’s markets and competitive market position

description:

Location: Lansing, MI

Duration: 12+ months

 * Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs

 * Prepares State of Michigan project templates in accordance with proper procedures
 * Is adept at proofing documents for errors in business and technical descriptions and overall grammar and spelling
 * Assists in the deployment and management of user reporting tools and platforms
 * Documents and provides knowledge transfer
 * Has knowledge of commonly used concepts, practices, and procedures within the enterprise-level software field
 * Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals, independently performs a variety of complicated tasks, and a wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected
 * Is a team player and willing to take on tasks that may not be “in my swim lane” in order to move the project forward
 * Demonstrable leadership and communication skills will be a highly desired skill set
   
   

Skills Needed


 * Strong oral and written communication skills are mandatory
 * Experience in interface and integration testing
 * Data migration experience
 * Minimum of 15+ years of experience in the field
   
   

Expert verbal and written communication with clients and technical staff in English along with ability to proof documents in English Required 15 Years

title: Business Analyst
description:
Employment Type: Full-Time, Experienced

Department: Information Technology

CGS is looking for business analysts to work with a large federal agency! As a Business Analyst in Business operations and Content Strategy for CGS, you will partner with internal business owners and external partners to understand new business opportunities and define functional requirements.

CGS brings motivated, highly skilled, and creative people together to solve the government’s most dynamic problems with cutting-edge technology. To carry out our mission, we are seeking candidates who are excited to contribute to government innovation, appreciate collaboration, and can anticipate the needs of others. Here at CGS, we offer an environment in which our employees feel supported, and we encourage professional growth through various learning opportunities.

Skills and attributes for success:


 * Support the development of briefings, agendas, and other general documentation support as directed, including training material and demonstration sessions for new and existing technologies to various stakeholders
 * Document and analyze business and functional requirements so that they may be accurately translated into process maps and technical system requirements
 * Develop comprehensive documentation that meets organizational standards, to include but not limited to basic system architectural diagrams/wireframes, concepts of operations, monthly status reports
 * Create high-level briefings and communications materials for customers, management, and executive stakeholders
 * Work with the government and team members to identify, recommend, and implement opportunities for service delivery improvement and new technology implementation
 * Evaluate program materials and develop innovative approaches for improvement
 * Independently gather information from subject matter experts to develop, organize, and write procedure manuals, technical specifications, and process documentation
 * Develop and implement a deep understanding of Microsoft and Atlassian products and services (Teams, SharePoint, Visio, Jira, Confluence) to translate complex product information into simple, polished, and engaging content
 * Research, outline, write, and edit new and existing content, working closely with various team members to understand project requirements
 * Develop content in various media forms for maximum usability, with a consistent and cohesive voice across all documentation
 * Perform risk management, including identifying, prioritizing, and mitigating risks, and communicating and escalating risks and issues
 * Support a continuous improvement process by providing recommendations on improving products, services, and processes
 * Manage client interaction and expectations regarding team efforts
 * Identify and coordinate cross-team dependencies and collaboration
 * Continually seek opportunities to increase customer satisfaction, develop and deepen long-lasting client relationships
   
   
   

Qualifications:


 * Must be a U.S. Citizen
 * Bachelor's Degree (Computer Science, or engineering)
 * Must be able to successfully complete a stringent Background Investigation and obtain required Government Security clearance
 * 7+ years of experience in business analysis, systems analysis, and/or design of information systems programs and related business processes
 * Experience working with phase-based and Agile delivery methods
 * Experience with Jira or other Agile tools
 * Ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical users
 * Must be able to work well both in a team environment and independently
 * Must possess exceptional attention to detail
 * Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
 * Familiarity with government projects and policy/procedures teams
 * Demonstrates ability to interact comfortably with Senior Leadership and/or Government Executives and staff on a day-to-day basis
 * Experience in managing client requirements and small teams
 * Excellent analytical skills and business presentation skills
   
   
   

Ideally, you will also have:


 * Experience supporting DHS HQ or other US Federal Agencies
 * Experience tracking and reporting project or program delivery progress and budget execution
 * Experience developing project briefs and reports for non-technical audiences
 * Knowledge of the federal acquisition lifecycle
 * Familiarity with Business Intelligence and Data Analytics
 * Project Management, Agile, and/or Cyber Certifications (PMP / ACP / CSM / SAFe / CISM)
   
   
   

Our Commitment:

Contact Government Services (CGS) strives to simplify and enhance government bureaucracy through the optimization of human, technical, and financial resources. We combine cutting-edge technology with world-class personnel to deliver customized solutions that fit our client’s specific needs. We are committed to solving the most challenging and dynamic problems.

For the past seven years, we’ve been growing our government contracting portfolio, and along the way, we’ve created valuable partnerships by demonstrating a commitment to honesty, professionalism, and quality work.

Here at CGS we value honesty through hard work and self-awareness, professionalism in all we do, and to deliver the best quality to our consumers mending those relations for years to come.

We care about our employees. Therefore, we offer a comprehensive benefits package.


 * Health, Dental, and Vision
 * Life Insurance
 * 401k
 * Flexible Spending Account (Health, Dependent Care, and Commuter)
 * Paid Time Off and Observance of State/Federal Holidays
   
   
   

Contact Government Services, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will be considered without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Join our team and become part of government innovation!

https://cgsfederal.com/join-our-team/

For more information about CGS please visit: https://www.cgsfederal.com or contact:

Email: info@cgsfederal.com

title: - Business Analyst
description:
Level 2 Business Analyst

an anticipated start date of 7/5/24,

listed duration of 32 Months,

located in Albany, NY (50% On-Site Requirement )

Roles & Responsibilities


 * The Business Analyst (BA) will conduct requirements analysis of the state systems and document requirements to assist in implementation of IES.
 * The BA will identify and document as-is and to-be IES system requirements using the IES prescribed business analysis methodology including but not limited to business process flows, detailed use cases, business rules catalogs, context diagrams, and wireframes.
 * The BA will meet with relevant stakeholders, including agency and local district subject matter experts, users, and executive teams to elicit requirements.
 * The BA will produce artifacts that reflect and ensure system planning, design, and delivery are in line with business needs.
 * The BA will conduct peer reviews, understand and adhere to project timelines and priorities, and work with blended teams of State and vendor resources.
   
   

NOTE: DESIRABLE QUALIFICATIONS ARE BASICALLY MANDATORY

Mandatory Qualifications


 * Level II- Between four (4) and seven (7) years of experience as a Business Analyst
 * Between four (4) and seven (7) years of client centered business analysis experience including: Conducting and leading requirements gathering sessions, analyzing requirements gathered, working on software development projects with an active role working with stakeholders, project managers, technical teams, and other business analysts.
 * Between four (4) and seven (7) years of extensive requirements analysis experience including: Identifying, documenting, and validating system requirements that span multiple complex domains for continuous integration and deployment and preparing proposals for best fit technology based on the elicited requirements.
   
   

Desirable Qualifications


 * Between four (4) and seven (7) years of experience identifying, documenting and validating system requirements in the Human Service domain with a focus on enrollment, eligibility, case management, financial management, and child support.
 * Between four (4) and seven (7) years of experience identifying, documenting, and validating system requirements on a modernization project covering several complex functional domains.
 * Between four (4) and seven (7) years of experience working independently on end-to-end business process analysis and optimization in a technology environment, while documenting the To-Be requirements for the online solution.
 * Between four (4) and seven (7) years of experience creating requirement artifacts such as: business process flows, detailed use cases, business rules catalogs, data dictionaries, wireframes , and specifications while adhering to pre-established templates.
 * Between four (4) and seven (7) years of experience in facilitation which may include requirement workshop preparations, facilitating and leading collaborative sessions with stakeholders, discussions with leadership, and reporting on project status.
 * Between four (4) and seven (7) years of experience implementing web based, client facing applications and aligning requirements with federal standards, conditions, and regulations

description:

 * Regularly host calls, serve as an active participant in other’s meetings and be an advocate for creating, reviewing, approving and implementing member facing operational letters
 * Manage the review and approval workflow for transactional member facing communications, including Business SME, legal, compliance and regulatory approvals

title: AI Business Analyst
description:
Job Title: Sr. AI Business Analyst

Location: Prefer NY, but remote ok in EST time zone

Job Description

We are seeking a highly experienced AI Business Analyst to analyse and write business requirement document (BRD) to help PayPal build a centralized Enterprise AI Risk Management System (“System”) to meet AI regulatory and internal governance requirements. The System will include, but not limited to, AI inventory management, AI Risk Management throughout the lifecycle including initiation, development, validation, deployment, monitoring, change management, retirement. The System is PayPal’s enterprise governance platform to warrant our AI development and use are ethical. As an AI Business Analyst, you are responsible for following and understanding evolving AI regulatory requirements (e.g., EU AI Act) and collaborating with various SMEs at PayPal to ensure PayPal’s AI uses are properly recorded and the associated AI risks are adequately assessed and mitigated globally. The System will be delivered in a phased approach including, but not limited to, architecture design


 * global AI inventory creation and maintenance including existing AI/model inventory conversion
 * AI/model governance functions (e.g., model submission, validation and approval, AI use case assessment and approval including but not limited to data and privacy, security, intellectual property)
 * tracking and reporting functions
   
   

Responsibilities


 * conduct thorough gap analysis and propose optimal scalable solution by effectively leveraging existing resources (including available platforms, systems, SMEs) and minimize redundant work
 * lead and drive the individual work streams associated with Responsible AI development and use globally, collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure regulatory and internal AI governance requirements are clearly communicated, aligned, and documented
 * ensure System functions including, but not limited to, GUI design, logic flow of the governance requirements such as request submission, review and approval, post launch monitoring, issue escalation and reporting are accurately and properly reflected in the BRD; work with engineering and product teams closely to ensure timely delivery
 * test during and post system development to ensure the System functions are integrated well and work as intended, document all tests and outcomes, critical decisions made by stakeholders and rationale
 * ensure any bugs or potential design/scalability issues identified during development and testing phases communicated timely to all relevant stakeholders and documented, and assist PayPal engineers and product managers to resolve timely
 * Manage the project proactively and play pivotal role in timely delivery
   
   

Requirements


 * An advanced degree (bachelor or master) in an equivalent field such as business, management, management of information system
 * A very experienced technical writer with proven track record on large scale system development
 * Solid understanding machine learning features/data, and AI/model lifecycle risk management
 * Stay abreast of the latest advancements in the field of Generative AI and AI regulatory changes and convert them to actions applicable to PayPal
 * Outstanding communication skills to be able to effectively present business goals, issues/challenges, gaps/findings, and solutions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
 * Operate with velocity and an ownership mindset and proactively deliver great end-to-end results both independently and in a team environment
 * A passionate fast learner with ability to research, learn, and apply advanced technical and non-technic skills related to AI/model
 * Ability to build strong relationship with both internal and external stakeholders and ensure effective engagement.
   
   

Calypso Way is a California technology staffing service, that delivers a competitive advantage for its customers through software, solutions, and services. Established in 2019. Calypso Way is headquartered in San Ramon, California. We work with technology giants in Silicon Valley California.

title: Business Analyst
description:

 * Ability to work in a fast-paced environment  Good communication and presentation skills
   
   
   

Requirements

 * Bachelor's degree. Additional qualifying experience in excess to the minimum stated above may be substituted for the required education on a year for year basis.
 * Ability to work with business enterprise software.

 * Ability to create and analyze reports

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
Job Title: Senior Business Analyst

Job Summary

The Senior Business Analyst plays a crucial role in bridging the gap between business needs and technology solutions. This position involves analyzing business processes, identifying areas for improvement, and implementing solutions that enhance efficiency, productivity, and profitability. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical skills, deep business acumen, and the ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Responsibilities


 * Lead the analysis and documentation of complex business processes and systems.
 * Collaborate with stakeholders to gather, define, and prioritize business requirements.
 * Develop and present business cases for proposed projects or process improvements.
 * Work closely with IT and development teams to translate business requirements into technical specifications.
 * Conduct feasibility studies, risk assessments, and cost-benefit analyses for proposed solutions.
 * Monitor project progress, ensuring that deliverables meet business requirements and timelines.
 * Provide mentorship and guidance to junior analysts, fostering a culture of continuous improvement.
 * Communicate findings and recommendations to senior management and other stakeholders through reports and presentations.
 * Ensure alignment of business objectives with technology solutions and organizational strategy.
   
   

Qualifications


 * Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, or a related field.
 * 5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst, with at least 2 years in a senior role.
 * Strong knowledge of business process modeling, data analysis, and requirements gathering.
 * Proficiency with analytical tools and methodologies (e.g., SWOT analysis, BPMN, use case modeling).
 * Experience with project management and familiarity with Agile and Waterfall methodologies.
 * Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively across teams.
 * Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think strategically.
 * Experience in mentoring or leading junior analysts is preferred.
 * Certification in business analysis (e.g., CBAP, PMI-PBA) is a plus.
