 * MMIS experience (project or operations) (…..Years)
 * Microsoft Office Project/Project Server (…..Years)
   
   

Required Education

Bachelor’s degree in a technical, business, or healthcare field.

title: Junior Business Analyst
description:
Looking for a Project Manager/Business Analyst with 3-5 years of experience. Bachelors degree required. 80% remote and 20% onsite.







Our client is seeking a Project Business Analyst who has business analyst project experience. This role will provide support for organization change by defining needs, recommending solutions, and supporting project management activities for initiatives.




The position will be primarily remote but will require onsite work when needed.




Key Accountabilities:

 * Oversee project elements of the business case, eliciting requirements, requirements analysis, communication, testing, and training.
 * Assist in development and implementation of strategic and support plans
 * Assist with request for proposal (RFP) activities to deliver functional requirements, vendor scorecards, criteria and scoring results, and demo scenarios
 * Facilitate the collection and delivery of requirements, business/use cases, documentation, and test plans, cases, scripts, management, and approval
 * Support the execution of process improvement initiatives, creating process flow charts, value stream mapping, and related documentation
 * Assist in the creation and use of measurement activities required to report on project effectiveness, return on investment (ROI), and other success metrics
 * Assist in the project documentation management based on the needs of each project
 * Collaborate with stakeholders and project team members to improve the quality of project and program delivery
 * Assist in the education and promotion of related methodologies and processes to stakeholders across the institute
 * Perform ongoing learning and training related to business analysis, project management, and stakeholder activities

Skills:

 * Intermediate knowledge of Business Analysis Body of Knowledge (BABOK) guidelines
 * Fundamental knowledge of Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK) guidelines
 * Fundamental knowledge of change management principles
 * Fundamental knowledge of healthcare / research operations and systems
 * Fundamental knowledge of risk management principles
 * Advanced proficiency in business analysis techniques and principles
 * Advanced proficiency with office software (Microsoft Office) including word processing, spreadsheet, presentation, and diagramming software (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio)
 * Excellent verbal and written communications skills
 * Excellent critical thinking / problem-solving skills
 * Excellent customer service skills
 * Excellent organizational skills
 * Strong presentation skills
 * Ability to collaborate with stakeholders at all levels
 * Ability to influence others to accomplish tasks outside of the direct span of control




Licenses and Certifications

 * Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) from the International Institute of Business Analysis (IIBA), PMI Professional in Business Analysis (PMI-PBA), Project Management Professional (PMP), Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM), and/or ASQ Six Sigma Green Belt (CSSGB) or Black Belt (CSSGB) certifications are preferred




Experience:

 * Three (3) to five (5) years of business analysis experience
 * Experience overseeing medium-to-large complex projects with increasing responsibilities is preferred
 * One (1) year of project management experience in small-to-medium initiatives is preferred
 * Previous experience in a healthcare, research, or academic-related environment is preferred

Education:

 * Bachelor's degree is required
 * Advanced degree in Healthcare, Healthcare IT, Business Administration, Management or related field is preferred
sector: Information Technology & Services and Hospitals and Health Care

title: Business Analyst
description:
Business Analyst

12 Month Rolling Contract

Hybrid, Onsite 3 Days a Week




Responsible for coordinating and assisting the department to design, configure implement, test, and support a state-of-the-art omnichannel system. This includes ensuring a seamless transition between the legacy and a new omnichannel telephony system and integrated Voice Response (IVR) and Interactive Routing (IR) system.




Provides post-implementation support in the following areas:




 * Data Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret customer data from various sources such as surveys, feedback, and transactional data to discover trends, patterns, and insights that can guide customer experience initiatives.
 * Feedback Management: Monitor and manage customer feedback channels, such as surveys and reviews, to extract valuable insights and track customer sentiment. Collaborate with relevant teams to address issues and capitalize on opportunities.
 * Customer Journey Mapping: Develop and maintain detailed customer journey maps to visualize touchpoints and interactions, identify pain points, and identify areas for continuous improvement.
 * Performance Metrics: Define, track, and report on key performance indicators (KPIs) related to customer experience.
 * Recommendation Development: Generate data-driven recommendations and action plans to enhance customer experience, which may include process improvements, product enhancements, and communication strategies.
 * Cross-functional Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, such as marketing, product development, and customer support, to implement improvements in customer experience and ensure alignment with business objectives.
 * Customer Segmentation: Segment the customer base based on behavior, preferences, and demographics to personalize interactions and marketing efforts.
 * Market Research: Stay informed about industry trends, competitive landscapes, and emerging technologies to suggest innovative solutions for improving customer experience.




Additional Information

 * The qualified candidate will enable the Department to collaborate with the vendor to design a new, state-of-the-art telephone system and provide post-implementation support to ensure the best possible customer experience.
 * Technical information: This will be a new system. Experience needed with Genesys Multicloud CX applications, speech and interaction analytics (CallMiner Eureka Platform), BOT engines, and data reporting and analytics




Education:




 * Bachelor’s degree in business, Data Analytics, or a related field. A master's degree is a plus or other related field with Six Sigma certification. Or equivalent work experience in telephony systems and process improvement.
 * Proven proficiency in data analysis and interpretation, utilizing data analytics tools and techniques.
 * Strong grasp of customer experience principles and methodologies.
 * Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, for presenting findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
 * Strong problem-solving abilities with attention to detail and a dedication to continuous improvement.
 * Proficiency in customer feedback management platforms.
 * Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.
 * Familiarity with statistical analysis and data visualization tools.
 * A customer-centric mindset and a passion for delivering outstanding customer experiences.
 * Strong project management skills to drive initiatives from concept to implementation.

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
Responsibilities

A Kforce client in Boston, MA that is seeking a Senior Business Analyst to work on a few critical projects. Responsibilities:


 * The Senior Business Analyst will partner with stakeholders and development teams to help elicit, analyze, and document business requirements and facilitate translation into technical requirements
 * Support the Program Managers with implementation projects in collaboration with vendor partner teams and business stakeholders
 * Effectively communicate requirements conflicts to project leads, assist with conflict resolution
 * Ensure that requirements are understood and approved by all stakeholders
 * Manage requirement traceability and changes throughout the project lifecycle
 * The Senior Business Analyst will ensure the test strategy and test plans adequately cover the requirements
 * Assist in defect resolution
   
   

Requirements


 * Bachelor's degree or at least 3 years of related experience in a technical environment
 * Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, or similar preferred
 * Business Analyst certification preferred
 * 5+ years of Business Analysis experience
 * Experience implementing and working with Salesforce Solutions
 * Experience utilizing a SAFe Agile framework
 * Experience managing vendor consultants
 * Experience in implementing continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD), preferably Worked in a Salesforce implementation project
 * Experience creating documents, such as Business Requirement Documents, Software Requirement Documents, process workflows, RAIDQs, Project Plans, User guides/Training materials among others
 * Solid understanding of Project Management methodologies and practices to be able to work closely with a Program Manager and seamlessly move into the PM role on occasion
 * Experience with evaluating project risks and issues and assisting Program Manager/Portfolio Manager with prioritization and development of mitigation or resolution strategies
 * Ability to apply business analysis experience and project management knowledge to real world scenarios
 * Experience in facilitating requirement analysis sessions with large and diverse stakeholder groups through requirements meetings, workshops, JAD sessions, etc.
 * Experience with analyzing inefficient business processes (manual entry, old technology, migrations, etc.) and working with business stakeholders and IT partners to create requirements for effective automated solutions
 * Experience creating visual diagrams of the system by UML (Use case, Activity, Business Process Diagrams), and creating web page mock-ups
 * Proficient with MS Office; including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Visio
 * Agile Project Methodology and JIRA knowledge preferred
   
   

The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

title: Level 2 Business Analyst
description:
Level 2 Business Analyst (4-7 years)

Must Have Valid Linkedin

duration of 24 Months

HYBRID

located in Albany, NY (50% On-Site Requirement – Relocation Required).

anticipated start date of 9/13/24

Roles & Responsibilities

The Business Analyst (BA) will conduct requirements analysis of existing system processes and elicit, analyze, and document requirements for the implementation of the Fair Hearings System.

Responsibilities Include


 * Identify and document as-is and to-be requirements using IES program standards which may include context diagrams, process flows, use cases, business rules, and miscellaneous BA artifacts.
 * Conduct systems analysis and documentation on legacy mainframe systems.
 * Meet with multiple stakeholders and produce work products that reflect and ensure system planning, design, and delivery are in line with business needs.
 * Conduct artifact peer reviews, adhere to project timelines, and balance multiple priorities. The candidate is expected to travel during this engagement.
 * Travel may range from 10-25% of the candidates time depending on the consultant's work assignments.
    * Travel will occur throughout New York State and may involve overnight stays depending on the location and the work required; length and mode of travel will vary depending on the work assignment.

 * Awarded candidate is required to be onsite at their assigned work location at the frequency required by the Office of Information Technology Services (ITS). This frequency is subject to change with advanced notice.
    * Candidates who are unwilling to be onsite for the required timeframe will have their task orders terminated.
      

Mandatory Qualifications


 * Level II- Between four (4) and seven (7) years of experience as a Business Analyst
 * Between four (4) and seven (7) years of client centered business analysis experience including: Conducting and leading requirements gathering sessions, analyzing requirements gathered, working on software development projects with an active role working with stakeholders, project managers, technical teams, and other business analysts.
 * Between four (4) and seven (7) years of extensive requirements analysis experience including: Identifying, documenting, and validating system requirements that span multiple complex domains for continuous integration and deployment and preparing proposals for best fit technology based on the elicited requirements.
   
   

Desirable Qualifications


 * Between four (4) and seven (7) years of experience identifying, documenting and validating system requirements for a Human Service Modernization Project with a focus on enrollment, eligibility, case management, and fair hearings.
 * Between four (4) and seven (7) years of experience analyzing and validating mainframe system requirements from existing legacy systems, like COBOL.
 * Between four (4) and seven (7) years of experience working independently on end-to-end business process reengineering and optimization in a technology environment, while documenting the To-Be requirements for the online solution.
 * Between four (4) and seven (7) years of experience creating requirement artifacts such as: business process flows, detailed use cases, business rules catalogs, data dictionaries, wireframes, and specifications while adhering to pre-established templates.
 * Between four (4) and seven (7) years of experience in facilitation which may include requirement workshop preparations, facilitating and leading collaborative sessions with stakeholders, discussions with leadership, and reporting on project status.
 * Between four (4) and seven (7) years of experience working in or with the subject matter of legal, or adjudicative, court hearings, fair hearings, appeals or court procedure and processes.
 * Between four (4) and seven (7) years of experience implementing web based, client facing applications and aligning requirements with federal standards, conditions, and regulations.

title: Business Analyst - Entry Level
description:
Position Description

Launch a world-class career.

Are you fascinated by information technology and its role in innovative business solutions? Are you a collaborative problem solver who wants to build a dynamic career making an impact for some of the most influential companies and government agencies in the world? If so, we think CGI is just the place for you.

A typical day working as a Business Analyst with us is exciting. One moment you could be designing solutions that enhance how our clients use technology to empower commercial business processes or improve government services for citizens. The next you could be working with your manager to map out your career goals and plans to achieve them. Then you could be partnering directly with a client, answering their questions, and providing data-driven recommendations to help them succeed. A career at CGI can look like many things. When you join us, you’ll have access to limitless upward mobility, opportunity, and entrepreneurship.

This position is located in Fairfax in a hybrid working model.


 * Fall Application Period is from August 26 through November 11**
   
   

Your future duties and responsibilities

How You'll Make An Impact


 * You’ll become an expert on a client’s industry, customers, organization, and business objectives
 * Work alongside thought leaders to solve complex and critical challenges for our clients
 * Assess user requirements, procedures, and problems
 * Provide quality client support by answering questions and maintaining open communication
 * Make data-driven recommendations regarding business issues and resource allocation
 * Assess how well a product meets usability and its ability to meet our business needs
   
   

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

What you’ll bring


 * You have a bachelor's degree - all majors encouraged to apply!
 * A positive attitude and a hunger for learning
 * You are a collaborative problem solver
 * You’re also flexible and can deal with ambiguity
 * You can work in the U.S. for an indefinite period without restriction
   
   

Let’s Talk About Benefits


 * Competitive base salary
 * Comprehensive insurance options
 * 401(k) with company match
 * Share purchase plan with a company match
 * Paid vacation, holidays, and sick leave
 * Up to 14 weeks of Maternity Leave with full pay
 * 4-week Parental Leave for all non-birth parents
 * Attorney-assisted will preparation
 * Health savings account
 * Disability, life, and accidental death insurance
 * Pet insurance
 * Work-life balance and flexibility
 * Tuition assistance continuous learning opportunities
 * Training, mentoring, and career development
 * Member assistance program
 * Wellness program
 * Member resource groups that provide community
   
   

The best version of you starts here

We’re a global company of owners. Over 90,000 members strong, we bring our diverse backgrounds and perspectives together to solve some of IT and business consulting’s toughest problems for some of the world’s best companies. Looking for a place that empowers you to explore your full potential and shape your own career? The scale and reach of our impact offer you just that. Join a team of great people, collaborate on meaningful work, and serve the communities you call home while you do it.

CGI is required by law in some jurisdictions to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. The determination of this range includes various factors not limited to skill set level, experience and training, and licensure and certifications. To support the ability to reward for merit-based performance, CGI typically does not hire individuals at or near the top of the range for their role. Compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is $54,400 - $89,700.

#CGIEarlyCareers

Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.

Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.

Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.

You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.

Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, ancestry, color, sex, religion, creed, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, pregnancy, medical condition, military and veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or perceived sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, and gender expression, familial status, political affiliation, genetic information, height, weight, or any other legally protected status or characteristics.

CGI provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need an accommodation to apply for a job in the U.S., please email the CGI U.S. Employment Compliance mailbox at US_Employment_Compliance@cgi.com. You will need to reference the Position ID of the position in which you are interested. Your message will be routed to the appropriate recruiter who will assist you. Please note, this email address is only to be used for those individuals who need an accommodation to apply for a job. Emails for any other reason or those that do not include a Position ID will not be returned.

We make it easy to translate military experience and skills! Click here to be directed to our site that is dedicated to veterans and transitioning service members.

All CGI offers of employment in the U.S. are contingent upon the ability to successfully complete a background investigation. Background investigation components can vary dependent upon specific assignment and/or level of US government security clearance held. Dependent upon role and/or federal government security clearance requirements, and in accordance with applicable laws, some background investigations may include a credit check. CGI will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrests and conviction records in accordance with all local regulations and ordinances.

CGI will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with CGI’s legal duty to furnish information.

title: Business Analyst – Austin, Texas
description:
Join a leading healthcare technology company that offers a comprehensive range of services, from education and diagnosis to prescription and delivery. We are constantly innovating and expanding our portfolio of products and brands to meet the diverse needs of our patients.

As a Business Analyst, you will be an integral part of our dynamic team, working closely with both business and technical stakeholders to translate requirements into solutions. You will also ensure clear and effective communication throughout the project lifecycle and help us achieve our goals and vision.

If you are looking for an exciting and rewarding career in a fast-growing and cutting-edge industry, and you have a strong background in developing algorithms for high-traffic digital platforms, we would love to hear from you.

*** This is an on-site 5 days a week role***

Responsibilities


 * Conduct comprehensive analysis of business needs, system processes, and operational impacts for various clients and projects.
 * Seek out and pursue new partnerships, projects, and opportunities that align with our vision and goals.
 * Lead and manage projects from inception to completion, ensuring quality, timeliness, and stakeholder satisfaction.
 * Monitor and evaluate the performance of each program/account, identify root causes of issues, and implement corrective actions as needed.
 * Oversee the management and optimization of applications and conduct intensive research and analysis of new methods and technologies to enhance productivity.
 * Deliver analytical support and insights, and proactively identify and respond to emerging business trends and opportunities.
 * Plan and prioritize the work schedule for the team and adhere to the project timeline and deadlines.
 * Regulatory Compliance: Keep abreast of the latest healthcare regulations, compliance standards, and industry best practices. Ensure that reconciliation processes comply with all relevant rules and policies.
 * Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with various stakeholders, communicate effectively, and address their needs, concerns, and feedback.
 * Travel occasionally as required, but not frequently.
   
   

Qualifications


 * A bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as Business Administration or Information Technology.
 * Demonstrated success in performing business analysis or similar functions.
 * Experience working in life-sciences - ideally in pharmaceuticals
 * Ability to analyze and solve complex problems effectively.
 * Outstanding communication and relationship-building skills.
 * Proficiency in using various business analysis tools and techniques.
 * Understanding of project management best practices and frameworks.
 * Experience in working with data analysis and reporting tools.
 * Additional credentials such as CBAP or PMI-PBA are desirable.
   
   

Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Business Analyst
description:
Employment Type: Full-Time, Experienced

Department: Information Technology

CGS is looking for business analysts to work with a large federal agency! As a Business Analyst in Business operations and Content Strategy for CGS, you will partner with internal business owners and external partners to understand new business opportunities and define functional requirements.

CGS brings motivated, highly skilled, and creative people together to solve the government’s most dynamic problems with cutting-edge technology. To carry out our mission, we are seeking candidates who are excited to contribute to government innovation, appreciate collaboration, and can anticipate the needs of others. Here at CGS, we offer an environment in which our employees feel supported, and we encourage professional growth through various learning opportunities.

Skills and attributes for success:


 * Support the development of briefings, agendas, and other general documentation support as directed, including training material and demonstration sessions for new and existing technologies to various stakeholders
 * Document and analyze business and functional requirements so that they may be accurately translated into process maps and technical system requirements
 * Develop comprehensive documentation that meets organizational standards, to include but not limited to basic system architectural diagrams/wireframes, concepts of operations, monthly status reports
 * Create high-level briefings and communications materials for customers, management, and executive stakeholders
 * Work with the government and team members to identify, recommend, and implement opportunities for service delivery improvement and new technology implementation
 * Evaluate program materials and develop innovative approaches for improvement
 * Independently gather information from subject matter experts to develop, organize, and write procedure manuals, technical specifications, and process documentation
 * Develop and implement a deep understanding of Microsoft and Atlassian products and services (Teams, SharePoint, Visio, Jira, Confluence) to translate complex product information into simple, polished, and engaging content
 * Research, outline, write, and edit new and existing content, working closely with various team members to understand project requirements
 * Develop content in various media forms for maximum usability, with a consistent and cohesive voice across all documentation
 * Perform risk management, including identifying, prioritizing, and mitigating risks, and communicating and escalating risks and issues
 * Support a continuous improvement process by providing recommendations on improving products, services, and processes
 * Manage client interaction and expectations regarding team efforts
 * Identify and coordinate cross-team dependencies and collaboration
 * Continually seek opportunities to increase customer satisfaction, develop and deepen long-lasting client relationships
   
   
   

Qualifications:


 * Must be a U.S. Citizen
 * Bachelor's Degree (Computer Science, or engineering)
 * Must be able to successfully complete a stringent Background Investigation and obtain required Government Security clearance
 * 7+ years of experience in business analysis, systems analysis, and/or design of information systems programs and related business processes
 * Experience working with phase-based and Agile delivery methods
 * Experience with Jira or other Agile tools
 * Ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical users
 * Must be able to work well both in a team environment and independently
 * Must possess exceptional attention to detail
 * Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
 * Familiarity with government projects and policy/procedures teams
 * Demonstrates ability to interact comfortably with Senior Leadership and/or Government Executives and staff on a day-to-day basis
 * Experience in managing client requirements and small teams
 * Excellent analytical skills and business presentation skills
   
   
   

Ideally, you will also have:


 * Experience supporting DHS HQ or other US Federal Agencies
 * Experience tracking and reporting project or program delivery progress and budget execution
 * Experience developing project briefs and reports for non-technical audiences
 * Knowledge of the federal acquisition lifecycle
 * Familiarity with Business Intelligence and Data Analytics
 * Project Management, Agile, and/or Cyber Certifications (PMP / ACP / CSM / SAFe / CISM)
   
   
   

Our Commitment:

Contact Government Services (CGS) strives to simplify and enhance government bureaucracy through the optimization of human, technical, and financial resources. We combine cutting-edge technology with world-class personnel to deliver customized solutions that fit our client’s specific needs. We are committed to solving the most challenging and dynamic problems.

For the past seven years, we’ve been growing our government contracting portfolio, and along the way, we’ve created valuable partnerships by demonstrating a commitment to honesty, professionalism, and quality work.

Here at CGS we value honesty through hard work and self-awareness, professionalism in all we do, and to deliver the best quality to our consumers mending those relations for years to come.

We care about our employees. Therefore, we offer a comprehensive benefits package.


 * Health, Dental, and Vision
 * Life Insurance
 * 401k
 * Flexible Spending Account (Health, Dependent Care, and Commuter)
 * Paid Time Off and Observance of State/Federal Holidays
   
   
   

Contact Government Services, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will be considered without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Join our team and become part of government innovation!

Explore additional job opportunities with CGS on our Job Board:

https://cgsfederal.com/join-our-team/

For more information about CGS please visit: https://www.cgsfederal.com or contact:

Email: info@cgsfederal.com

title: Business Analyst
description:
Job Description

Why work at  Southpoint Consulting? We are not just a consultancy; since 2009 we have been a  family of creative minds, solution providers, and catalysts for change. We are committed to achieving outstanding outcomes and enabling federal IT programs to excel. Our commitment to quality and our drive to create an impact distinguishes us in the consulting industry. What’s our secret? A collaboration of top-notch talent, passion, and a whole lot of determination!

At the core of our company is our value system. Respect, Inclusiveness, Integrity, Transparency and Excellence form the foundation for everything we do. Explore further at www.southpointconsulting.com. 

What you will get to do 

The Business Analyst is responsible for supporting the PMO by analyzing and documenting business processes, identifying opportunities for improvement, and ensuring alignment with federal regulations and standards. This role involves collaborating with project managers and stakeholders to gather and validate requirements, developing detailed project documentation, and utilizing data to create reports and dashboards that track project performance and compliance. The Business Analyst also assists in the implementation of project management methodologies and tools, facilitates communication across teams, and contributes to the successful delivery of projects by providing insights and recommendations based on thorough analysis.




Key Responsibilities

 * Support requirement gathering efforts and produce business requirements, processes, and system specifications documentation. Ensure that all documentation is clear, accurate, and accessible to relevant stakeholders.
 * Contribute to project planning and execution, including defining scope, setting objectives, and managing timelines. Collaborate with project managers to ensure successful project delivery.
 * Work collaboratively with various stakeholders on deliverables and work products needed by the program, handle knowledge management, data analysis, and strategic program planning.
 * Evaluate and document business processes, workflows, and systems to identify areas for improvement. Develop and propose solutions to enhance operational efficiency and effectiveness.
 * Apply knowledge of federal government regulations and compliance requirements to ensure projects and processes adhere to applicable standards and guidelines.
 * Draft and develop high quality and error-free artifacts and documentations, such as standard operating procedures (SOPs), technical system maintenance notices, and quick technical reference guides.  
 * Lead and coordinate communications with various stakeholders to gain their input and concurrence on deliverables and work products. 
 * Ability to gather, organize, and communicate disintegrated information/data into a cohesive, concise, and meaningful work product.
 * Proactively listen to gather and recommend potential communications from other team members.
 * Ability to develop communication, potentially in multiple formats, that are formatted and written appropriate to internal or external audiences.
 * Ability to develop and manage a communications schedule and accurately track status of deliverables.
 * Work on-site at the client site three times a week in Washington DC (hybrid position)

   

Minimum Qualifications

 * Minimum 5+ years of government consulting experience
 * Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Management, Communications, or a related field. 
 * Proven experience as a Business Analyst
 * Resourceful to research information needed to deliver the required work products.
 * Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to convey complex information clearly to diverse audiences.
 * Strong analytical skills with experience in data analysis and reporting.
 * Proficiency in business analysis tools and software (e.g., Microsoft Excel, Visio, Tableau).
 * Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
 * Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Desired Qualifications

 * Familiarity with Google suite of products and Smartsheets
 * Experience with technical writing




If you are a dynamic and forward-thinking leader with a passion for driving innovation and collaboration in the public sector, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity to make a positive impact on government initiatives.

Southpoint Consulting offers a comprehensive benefits package for this position which include tuition and professional development, health, dental, vision, paid parental leave, company paid life and disability insurance, well-being, health savings, flexible spending, 401k with company matching, paid time off (PTO), and volunteer time off (VTO). 




Southpoint Consulting is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer who is committed to maintaining a diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, ethnicity, age, national origin, citizenship, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, family structure, marital status, ancestry, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law.




The salary range may vary for this position depending on various factors, which may include but are not limited to geographic location, role, skills, and qualifications.

title: Business Analyst/Scrum Master
description:
Aretum is seeking a talented and experienced individual to join our team as a Business Analyst/Scrum Master. As a Business Analyst/Scrum Master at Aretum, you will be responsible for capturing detailed business requirements and facilitating the Agile development process as a Scrum Master. You will work closely with the development team, stakeholders, and product owners to ensure successful project delivery.

Aretum is a leading technology company that specializes in providing innovative solutions to clients in various industries. We are committed to delivering high-quality products and services that meet the unique needs of our clients and contribute to their success.

Responsibilities{{:}}


 * Capture detailed business requirements, User Stories, and Acceptance Criteria in JIRA
 * Work with Product Owner/System Owner, Development, UX/UI, QA team, and Subject Matter Experts to ensure alignment and proper interpretation of complex functional requirements
 * Ensure end-to-end requirements traceability, mapping user stories to software test cases, applicable business processes, wireframes, and UX comps
 * Leverage strong written and verbal communication skills to drive requirements sessions in a large setting including Product Owners, Subject Matter Experts, Project Manager, Architect, Team Leads, and client personnel
 * Collaborate with team members, share knowledge, and continuously improve business analysis efforts, identify and close gaps
 * Document functional specifications, traceability matrices, process flow diagrams, wireframes, meeting agenda, meeting minutes, and other supporting artifacts
 * Lead and facilitate all Scrum ceremonies (Daily Stand-ups, Sprint Planning, Sprint Review, Sprint Retrospective, and Backlog Refinement) ensuring active participation from all team members and stakeholders
 * Proactively identify and remove impediments or guide the team to remove impediments, ensuring a smooth workflow and preventing delays in project delivery
 * Shield the team from external interferences and distractions to maximize productivity and focus on sprint goals
 * Monitor sprint progress, facilitate discussions, decision-making processes, and conflict resolution. Communicate progress and team dynamics to stakeholders and higher management
 * Assist the Product Owner in managing the product backlog, ensuring it is visible, transparent, and clear to all, and shows what the team will work on next





Requirements





 * 5+ years of experience in documenting business and functional requirements
 * 3+ years working in an Agile environment, with demonstrated ability to clearly articulate User Stories and Conditions of Satisfaction to development teams
 * Web-based software development experience involving complex workflows
 * Experience working with large size teams consisting of multiple Scrum teams
 * Demonstrated ability to elicit, create, and analyze functional and non-functional requirements
 * Experience organizing and maintaining Product and Sprint backlogs
 * Experience presenting detailed summaries of progress and updates
 * Ability to facilitate and drive group discussions to build a shared understanding of software requirements
 * Ability to foster solid working relationships with senior-level management and subject matter experts within the team and client organization
 * Propensity to mentor staff on functional expertise and provide peer reviews of deliverables for other product lines
 * Confident in requirement knowledge to help lead change and implement new strategies company-wide
 * Ability to work independently and in an awesome team setting
 * Experience with Jira and Confluence
 * Excellent written and verbal communication skills
   
   
   
   

Benefits



ARETUM is an equal opportunity employer, committed to diversity and inclusion. All qualified candidates will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to disability, race, color, religious creed, national origin, sexual orientation/gender identity, or age.

ARETUM utilizes e-Verify to check employment authorization.

EEO/AA/F/M/Vet/Disabled.

title: Business Analyst
description:
Employment Type: Full-Time, Experienced

Department: Information Technology

CGS is looking for business analysts to work with a large federal agency! As a Business Analyst in Business operations and Content Strategy for CGS, you will partner with internal business owners and external partners to understand new business opportunities and define functional requirements.

CGS brings motivated, highly skilled, and creative people together to solve the government’s most dynamic problems with cutting-edge technology. To carry out our mission, we are seeking candidates who are excited to contribute to government innovation, appreciate collaboration, and can anticipate the needs of others. Here at CGS, we offer an environment in which our employees feel supported, and we encourage professional growth through various learning opportunities.

Skills and attributes for success:


 * Support the development of briefings, agendas, and other general documentation support as directed, including training material and demonstration sessions for new and existing technologies to various stakeholders
 * Document and analyze business and functional requirements so that they may be accurately translated into process maps and technical system requirements
 * Develop comprehensive documentation that meets organizational standards, to include but not limited to basic system architectural diagrams/wireframes, concepts of operations, monthly status reports
 * Create high-level briefings and communications materials for customers, management, and executive stakeholders
 * Work with the government and team members to identify, recommend, and implement opportunities for service delivery improvement and new technology implementation
 * Evaluate program materials and develop innovative approaches for improvement
 * Independently gather information from subject matter experts to develop, organize, and write procedure manuals, technical specifications, and process documentation
 * Develop and implement a deep understanding of Microsoft and Atlassian products and services (Teams, SharePoint, Visio, Jira, Confluence) to translate complex product information into simple, polished, and engaging content
 * Research, outline, write, and edit new and existing content, working closely with various team members to understand project requirements
 * Develop content in various media forms for maximum usability, with a consistent and cohesive voice across all documentation
 * Perform risk management, including identifying, prioritizing, and mitigating risks, and communicating and escalating risks and issues
 * Support a continuous improvement process by providing recommendations on improving products, services, and processes
 * Manage client interaction and expectations regarding team efforts
 * Identify and coordinate cross-team dependencies and collaboration
 * Continually seek opportunities to increase customer satisfaction, develop and deepen long-lasting client relationships
   
   
   

Qualifications:


 * Must be a U.S. Citizen
 * Bachelor's Degree (Computer Science, or engineering)
 * Must be able to successfully complete a stringent Background Investigation and obtain required Government Security clearance
 * 7+ years of experience in business analysis, systems analysis, and/or design of information systems programs and related business processes
 * Experience working with phase-based and Agile delivery methods
 * Experience with Jira or other Agile tools
 * Ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical users
 * Must be able to work well both in a team environment and independently
 * Must possess exceptional attention to detail
 * Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
 * Familiarity with government projects and policy/procedures teams
 * Demonstrates ability to interact comfortably with Senior Leadership and/or Government Executives and staff on a day-to-day basis
 * Experience in managing client requirements and small teams
 * Excellent analytical skills and business presentation skills
   
   
   

Ideally, you will also have:


 * Experience supporting DHS HQ or other US Federal Agencies
 * Experience tracking and reporting project or program delivery progress and budget execution
 * Experience developing project briefs and reports for non-technical audiences
 * Knowledge of the federal acquisition lifecycle
 * Familiarity with Business Intelligence and Data Analytics
 * Project Management, Agile, and/or Cyber Certifications (PMP / ACP / CSM / SAFe / CISM)
   
   
   

Our Commitment:

Contact Government Services (CGS) strives to simplify and enhance government bureaucracy through the optimization of human, technical, and financial resources. We combine cutting-edge technology with world-class personnel to deliver customized solutions that fit our client’s specific needs. We are committed to solving the most challenging and dynamic problems.

For the past seven years, we’ve been growing our government contracting portfolio, and along the way, we’ve created valuable partnerships by demonstrating a commitment to honesty, professionalism, and quality work.

Here at CGS we value honesty through hard work and self-awareness, professionalism in all we do, and to deliver the best quality to our consumers mending those relations for years to come.

We care about our employees. Therefore, we offer a comprehensive benefits package.


 * Health, Dental, and Vision
 * Life Insurance
 * 401k
 * Flexible Spending Account (Health, Dependent Care, and Commuter)
 * Paid Time Off and Observance of State/Federal Holidays
   
   
   

Contact Government Services, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will be considered without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Join our team and become part of government innovation!

Explore additional job opportunities with CGS on our Job Board:

https://cgsfederal.com/join-our-team/

For more information about CGS please visit: https://www.cgsfederal.com or contact:

Email: info@cgsfederal.com

title: Business Analyst / Project Lead
description:
Business Analyst/Project Lead

Summary



 * Location: Remote w/ some travel
 * Description: A problem-solver who bridges the gap between the business requirements and technical solutions & A project manager, able to lead a small team to deliver successful projects on time, within budget, and to specification.
 * Top 3 Skills:
 * Labelling solutions experience (Preferably Loftware / Loftware Smartflow / Loftware Spectrum)
 * BA/Project Lead experience in a regulated environment (preferably health related)
 * MedTech experience is a plus



Responsibilities:

Business Analyst

 * Understand Our Business: Understand Business requirements related to Label and Artwork Management via stakeholder engagement. Understand today’s Business Processes related to Label and Artwork management, how things are done, what challenges exist, and the future goals of the organization.
 * Continuous improvement: Use research and analytical skills to identify areas for improvement and propose solutions.
 * Communication: Translate complex business needs into clear technical requirements.



Project Management

 * Project Planning: Agree project scope, set goals and objectives, and establish a clear plan for delivery.
 * Agile execution: Execute AGILE process to deliver enhancements in accordance with organizational priorities.
 * Resource Management: Manage Business Analysts/Developers to deliver agreed priorities. Ensure resources are used effectively and efficiently throughout the project lifecycle.
 * Communication: Communicate release and change management to stakeholders, ensuring everyone is aligned and expectations are managed.



Validation

Execute required Validation of changes in accordance with Global Test Management, including but not limited to:

 * Requirements/User Stories/Acceptance criteria: Collaborate with stakeholders to define/refine/maintain user requirements, associated user stories and acceptance criteria including associated maintenance in JIRA/Qtest.
 * Test Management: Collaborate with stakeholders to define/refine/maintain Test scenarios including associated maintenance in Qtest.
 * Test Execution: Execution of Testing in Qtest.
 * Validation documentation: Writing and Publishing associated Validation Plans and Reports.



Your Skills and Experience:



Business Analyst:

 * Analytical Thinking: Able to analyse and interpret complex data, identify patterns, and make informed decisions based on data-driven insights.
 * Communication: Strong verbal and written communication skills to effectively convey project requirements, goals, and progress to various stakeholders, including team members, clients, and senior management. Able to explain complex concepts concisely, bridging the gap between technical and non-technical audiences.
 * Problem-Solving: Able to identify problems, propose innovative solutions, and facilitate problem-solving sessions to address business challenges and ensure project success.
 * Technical knowledge: Familiarity with relevant technologies, software, and systems to assess and recommend appropriate solutions that align with business objectives.
 * Business acumen: Understanding of business processes, industry trends, and market dynamics to identify opportunities, challenges, and potential risks.



Project Management:

 * Project management: Proficiency in project management methodologies, tools, and techniques to plan, execute, monitor, and control projects, including defining scope, setting timelines, managing resources, and mitigating risks.
 * Collaboration and leadership: Strong interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams, foster teamwork, resolve conflicts, and motivate team members to meet project goals.
 * Adaptability: Flexibility to adapt to changing project requirements, priorities, and timelines, as well as the ability to quickly learn and apply new concepts and technologies.
 * Stakeholder management: Proficient in managing and influencing stakeholders at various levels, including clients, business leaders, project sponsors, and team members, to ensure project success and alignment with business goals.
 * Time management: Strong organizational skills to prioritize tasks, meet deadlines, and effectively manage multiple projects simultaneously.
 * Problem-Solving & Decision-Making: Adept at problem-solving, analysing situations, and making quick decisions to keep the project moving forward.
 * Leadership: A strong work ethic, able to delegate effectively, and foster a collaborative environment where everyone feels valued and contributes their best.

description:

You will play a key role in bridging the gap between business objectives and technical solutions.

 * Conduct thorough business analysis to identify needs, goals, and challenges.
 * Develop detailed business requirements and functional specifications.
 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement effective solutions.
 * Lead and facilitate workshops and meetings with stakeholders.
 * Monitor project progress and ensure alignment with business objectives.
 * Analyze data and generate reports to support decision-making.
 * Provide guidance and mentorship to junior analysts.

 * Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, or related field.
 * 5+ years of experience in business analysis or a related role.
 * Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
 * Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
 * Proficiency in data analysis and business intelligence tools.
 * Experience with Agile methodologies is a plus.
 * Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects.

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
Job Title: Senior Business Analyst

Job Summary: The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for leading the analysis of business processes, identifying areas for improvement, and supporting the development and implementation of solutions that drive business efficiency and growth. This role involves working closely with stakeholders to understand their needs, translating those into actionable requirements, and ensuring successful project delivery. The Senior Business Analyst plays a critical role in aligning business goals with technology solutions and improving overall organizational performance.

Responsibilities


 * Conduct in-depth analysis of business processes, workflows, and systems to identify opportunities for improvement.
 * Gather, document, and prioritize business requirements, ensuring they align with organizational objectives.
 * Collaborate with stakeholders to develop solutions that meet business needs and drive efficiency.
 * Lead the development of business cases, feasibility studies, and cost-benefit analyses to support decision-making.
 * Translate business requirements into functional specifications for IT and development teams.
 * Facilitate meetings and workshops with stakeholders to ensure clear communication and alignment on project goals.
 * Monitor project progress, ensuring that deliverables meet the required standards and timelines.
 * Provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis to support strategic planning and decision-making.
 * Mentor junior analysts and contribute to the continuous improvement of business analysis methodologies.
   
   

Qualifications


 * Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Information Systems, or a related field.
 * Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in business analysis, process improvement, or a related role.
 * Strong understanding of business processes, systems analysis, and project management methodologies.
 * Proven experience in gathering and documenting business requirements and translating them into actionable plans.
 * Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think strategically.
 * Proficiency in business analysis tools and techniques, such as SWOT analysis, BPMN, or UML.
 * Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with stakeholders at all levels.
 * Experience with Agile, Scrum, or other project management methodologies is a plus.
 * Professional certification such as CBAP (Certified Business Analysis Professional) is preferred.

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
Apply to the role if you live in Michigan with a valid Michigan DL.


 * All candidates should include 3 professional references with their submission (including the reference’s name, position, phone number, and email address).
 * This position is partially remote. The candidate will be required to report to a Lansing, MI office location on a regular basis. The selected candidate will be responsible for any and all costs associated with parking for this position. These costs will not be reimbursed.
   
   

Short Description: This project resource will work with our Direct client to review, analyze, and evaluate business processes around the implementation of a new enterprise-level software solution that will replace numerous aging legacy systems. Special emphasis will be placed on integration/interface processes and data migration.

Complete Description: This project resource will work with our Direct client to review, analyze, and evaluate functional requirements and business user needs around the implementation of a new enterprise-level software solution that will replace numerous aging legacy systems.

A special emphasis will be placed on testing the software solution prior to implementation and working with the project’s quality assurance team to prepare for and complete large-scale testing efforts. Demonstrable testing skills will be a highly desired skill set. This resource must be experienced in coordinating, designing, and implementing test plans in conjunction with a third-party software vendor and agency staff.

Special consideration will be given to candidates with integration/interface development experience and/or those with data migration experience.

Candidates with experience in gathering business requirements and functional requirements within client agencies and transforming those requirements into clear and precise language are highly valued. This resource will also be expected to support subject matter experts and other project team members by drafting design documents, being accountable for assuring that documents are filed on time, and that project vendors are provided accurate feedback on a range of deliverables.

This resource must be experienced in coordinating and communicating the efforts of multiple groups of technical and business groups (e.g. enterprise architecture analysts, database administrators, data scientists, business analysts, ETL developers, business subject matter experts, quality assurance and testing resources, and end users) in conjunction with a third-party software vendor. This project resource may also be responsible for developing and maintaining a system capable of tracking all assigned tasks.

This position has a high probability of being extended past the end date listed.

Years of Experience: Fifteen (15) or more years of experience in the field.

Additional Responsibilities


 * Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs
 * Facilitates user meetings for eliciting business process requirements and functional requirements
 * Prepares detailed descriptions of user needs, business functions, and the steps required to develop or modify automated systems to mirror business practices
 * Prepares State of Michigan project templates in accordance with proper procedures
 * Is adept at proofing documents for errors in business and technical descriptions and overall grammar and spelling
 * Assists in the deployment and management of user reporting tools and platforms
 * Documents and provides knowledge transfer
 * Has knowledge of commonly used concepts, practices, and procedures within the enterprise-level software field
 * Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals, independently performs a variety of complicated tasks, and a wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected
 * Is a team player and willing to take on tasks that may not be “in my swim lane” in order to move the project forward
 * Demonstrable leadership and communication skills will be a highly desired skill set

title: Business Management Analyst
description:
About Our Company

ConglomerateIT is a certified and a pioneer in providing premium end-to-end Global Workforce Solutions and IT Services to diverse clients across various domains. Visit us at ConglomerateIT. ConglomerateIT mission is to establish global cross culture human connections that further the careers of our employees and strengthen the businesses of our clients. We are driven to use the power of global network to connect business with the right people without bias. We provide Global Workforce Solutions with affability.




About the Role

Business Management Analyst

 * Duration: 12 months
 * Job Type: Remote
 * Experience: 7+ years required
 * Tax Terms: W2/1099




Responsibilities

 * Lead the design, development, and support of IT applications.
 * Plan, install, configure, test, and implement systems to align with organizational IT architecture and business needs.
 * Analyze and refine system requirements, translating them into prototypes and system architectures.
 * Write, maintain, and test code to ensure high-quality and secure software.
 * Design user interfaces and test applications with end-users.
 * Evaluate new technologies and ensure adherence to information security policies.




Qualifications

Required Skills

 * Strong knowledge of application software development, including design, testing, and implementation.
 * Experience with operating system installation and configuration.
 * Solid understanding of software design principles, database management, and systems engineering.
 * Ability to foster collaborative working relationships and communicate effectively.



Preferred Skills

 * Experience with Technology Business Management (TBM), Cloudability, FinOps, Cloud Cost Management, and Advanced Excel.



Required Experience

 * At least seven (7) years of experience in studying, designing, and programming electronic data processing systems.
 * Minimum of four (4) years in a leadership role.



Preferred Experience

 * Three (3) years of experience in IT billing, financial forecasting, and cloud cost management.
 * At least one (1) year of experience with Apptio Cost Transparency, IT Planning, and Cloudability or similar tools.




Required Education

 * Bachelor’s degree in an IT-related or engineering field. Additional relevant experience may be substituted for required education on a year-for-year basis.



Preferred Education

 * Current certification as a Technology Business Management Analyst (TMBA) or FinOps Certified Practitioner.

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
About Finzly:

Finzly is headquartered in Charlotte, NC, and was founded in 2012 by financial engineers whose mission is to create a modern, real-time, and responsive platform for bankers who need to break free from core limitations. Our initial success and wider adoption arrived after the introduction of our foreign exchange, trade finance, lending, digital banking, and branch banking solutions. Finzly is on a mission to free banks from their core banking systems and core-vendor limitations, by creating an Appstore ecosystem that empowers banks to launch new products and services instantly and easily. Finzly enables financial institutions to make smarter technology decisions while getting to market at fintech speed.




Recently, Finzly has won the “Best and Brightest Companies to Work For” of 2022 & 2023, Greatest Companies to Work for in NC 2024, and the “Best Parallel Core Technology” award at the NACHA Smarter Faster Payments Conference in 2023.




About the Role:

Finzly is on an exciting growth trajectory and is seeking a dynamic and enthusiastic individual to join our Professional Services team as a Senior Business Analyst. This role offers a unique opportunity to be a key customer-facing representative for our innovative payment products. We are looking for a well-organized professional who can prioritize and manage multiple responsibilities, including overseeing the implementation scope and serving as an ambassador for Finzly.




Why Join Finzly?

At Finzly, we are at the forefront of innovation in the financial technology space. Joining our team means being part of a forward-thinking company that values growth, learning, and career development. As a Senior Business Analyst, you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects, collaborate with industry experts, and make a significant impact on our clients’ success. Your future with Finzly is bright, with ample opportunities for professional growth and advancement.




Primary Job Responsibilities:

 * Product Expertise: Become a knowledge center and product expert for Finzly’s Payment Hub.
 * Documentation: Document product requirements, interface requirements, and system gaps, and create comprehensive delivery plans for customers.
 * Collaboration: Work closely with sales, product managers, and professional services teams to deliver tailored solutions.
 * Training & Demonstrations: Lead product training sessions and demonstrations for clients.
 * Innovation: Propose innovative solutions, establish customer delivery development priorities, and identify potential roadblocks.
 * Customer Success: Understand the success metrics for banks and credit unions, ensuring client satisfaction.
 * Travel: Occasionally travel to conferences and customer sites to represent Finzly.




Required Experience:

 * Payments Expertise: 5+ years of experience in ACH, FedWire, or RTP file formats and reconciliation.
 * Customer Experience: Proven track record of delivering payment products that enhance customer experience.
 * Core Banking Systems: Knowledge of core banking systems.
 * API & Data Services: Understanding of data services and API-based product offerings.
 * Project Management Knowledge: Understanding of project management principles and methodologies, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
 * Technical Skills: Experience creating flow charts, swim-lane diagrams and proficiency in JIRA, Microsoft Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio), .




Nice to have experience:

 * Solution Delivery: 2+ years of experience in providing solutions in ACH, FedWire, RTP or FX payments.
 * Accounting Knowledge: Experience with accounting for payments.
 * SQL & Scripting: Beneficial experience in SQL and scripting.




Preferred Skills and Qualifications:

 * Educational Background: Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business, or equivalent.
 * Certifications: AAP/APRP payment certification.
 * Critical Thinking: Strong critical thinking and decision-making skills.
 * Leadership: Exceptional leadership, planning, priority management, conflict management, and organizational skills.
 * Team Collaboration: Experience working with remote, geographically distributed, and cross-functional teams.
 * Communication: Excellent communication and written skills to effectively interact and influence various levels of the organization.




What We Offer:

 * Full Benefits Package - medical, dental, and vision coverage with HSA option
 * Healthcare FSA and Dependent Care FSA
 * Company-paid Life Insurance
 * Company-paid Long-Term Disability
 * Paid Holidays and generous Paid-Time Off
 * Stock Options
 * Retirement Savings Plan
 * Short Term Disability, Critical Illness, and Accident Insurance
 * Wellness Programs including Employee Assistance Program
 * Annual Cash Bonus and more!

title: Business Analyst
description:

The North Dakota Department of Human Services, Economic Assistance Division is seeking a Senior Business Analyst (BA) to assist the business team with software development changes to enhance eligibility and benefits applications managed through Economic Assistance. The BA must be well versed in program management, requirements gathering, process diagramming, operational concepts, usability, and testing.

process models and formal specifications.

 *      Ability to work independently with minimal supervision, be a team player, and be well organized and efficient with excellent judgment, problem-solving and decision-making skills.

Preferred

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
Juno Beach, FL - Onsite - Local or Non Local who can relocate immediately

Need Complete DOB and SSN Last 4 Digit

Must have valid LinkedIn

Must have 10/10 Communications

Client is seeking a Senior Business Analyst to join the Tax team located in Juno Beach, Florida.

Description

Position Background

We are seeking a Technology Professional to join the Tax Strategic Initiatives & Technology team. This professional will have several key responsibilities including: (1) providing the administration and configuration of key software applications for the tax department; (2) assisting business unit customers with support, analysis, and troubleshooting related to the efficient operation of the tax software products, and (3) supporting system upgrade exercises and testing for tax systems, supporting ongoing tax software project initiatives and establishing and maintaining relationships with key internal & external customers. This position will help ensure that NextEra Energy, Inc. remains “Best in Class” with regards to the quality and efficiency of our tax processes.

Job Description

Working under the supervision of the Director of Tax Technology, this position will be responsible for supporting the Tax department with their technology needs. The successful candidate will work closely with multiple business units within the organization in order to ensure a full understanding of the entire Tax department’s needs. The candidate will also be consulting with multiple stakeholders- tax professionals, IT teams and software vendors. In addition, the candidate will assist the Tax Department personnel with day-to-day operation of tax technology platforms.


 * Extended Hours may be necessary
   
   

Qualifications


 * Bachelor's degree in accounting or information management is preferred with a CPA or advanced degree a plus
 * Tax and ERP software such as OneSource Tax Provision, OneSource State Apportionment, Corptax and SAP
 * Microsoft Suite including Excel, Access, SharePoint, PowerPoint, and Word
 * Experience in corporate tax compliance and/or tax accounting
 * Project management or Six Sigma skills to facilitate excellent execution in tax projects is a plus
 * Excellent verbal, written, communication, decision making, analytical, and critical thinking skills
 * Aptitude to learn technologies being introduced or developed within the company including software products such as Alteryx and SAP Business Objects
   
   

Job Overview


 * Support cross functional tax automation and analytics projects
 * Work with business stakeholders, IT solution architects, and developers on tax technology projects
 * Manage multiple tax technology implementation projects using Waterfall or Agile methodology
 * Prepare documentation for project end to end lifecycle
 * Act as product owner for complex and cross functional implementation projects
 * Learn Alteryx Designer and develop process automation workflows to reduce process cycle time
   
   

Job Duties & Responsibilities


 * Liaising between the IT department and the Tax business partners
 * Acting as an information source and communicator between IT workstreams
 * Creating process flow diagrams and data flow diagrams
 * Understanding strategic business needs and plans for growth
 * Analyzing the design of technical systems and business models
 * Analyzing business needs
 * Sourcing and implementing new business technology
 * Finding technological solutions to meet business requirements
 * Producing reports on application development and implementation
 * Running systems/user acceptance testing and analyzing data
 * Analyzing data to inform business decisions
   
   

Required Qualifications


 * High School Grad / GED
 * Bachelor's - Accounting / Finance
 * Experience: 3+ years
   
   

Preferred Qualifications


 * Master's - Accounting / Finance
 * Tax Compliance
 * Tax Research

title: Business Analyst
description:
Employment Type: Full-Time, Experienced

Department: Information Technology

CGS is looking for business analysts to work with a large federal agency! As a Business Analyst in Business operations and Content Strategy for CGS, you will partner with internal business owners and external partners to understand new business opportunities and define functional requirements.

CGS brings motivated, highly skilled, and creative people together to solve the government’s most dynamic problems with cutting-edge technology. To carry out our mission, we are seeking candidates who are excited to contribute to government innovation, appreciate collaboration, and can anticipate the needs of others. Here at CGS, we offer an environment in which our employees feel supported, and we encourage professional growth through various learning opportunities.

Skills and attributes for success:


 * Support the development of briefings, agendas, and other general documentation support as directed, including training material and demonstration sessions for new and existing technologies to various stakeholders
 * Document and analyze business and functional requirements so that they may be accurately translated into process maps and technical system requirements
 * Develop comprehensive documentation that meets organizational standards, to include but not limited to basic system architectural diagrams/wireframes, concepts of operations, monthly status reports
 * Create high-level briefings and communications materials for customers, management, and executive stakeholders
 * Work with the government and team members to identify, recommend, and implement opportunities for service delivery improvement and new technology implementation
 * Evaluate program materials and develop innovative approaches for improvement
 * Independently gather information from subject matter experts to develop, organize, and write procedure manuals, technical specifications, and process documentation
 * Develop and implement a deep understanding of Microsoft and Atlassian products and services (Teams, SharePoint, Visio, Jira, Confluence) to translate complex product information into simple, polished, and engaging content
 * Research, outline, write, and edit new and existing content, working closely with various team members to understand project requirements
 * Develop content in various media forms for maximum usability, with a consistent and cohesive voice across all documentation
 * Perform risk management, including identifying, prioritizing, and mitigating risks, and communicating and escalating risks and issues
 * Support a continuous improvement process by providing recommendations on improving products, services, and processes
 * Manage client interaction and expectations regarding team efforts
 * Identify and coordinate cross-team dependencies and collaboration
 * Continually seek opportunities to increase customer satisfaction, develop and deepen long-lasting client relationships
   
   
   

Qualifications:


 * Must be a U.S. Citizen
 * Bachelor's Degree (Computer Science, or engineering)
 * Must be able to successfully complete a stringent Background Investigation and obtain required Government Security clearance
 * 7+ years of experience in business analysis, systems analysis, and/or design of information systems programs and related business processes
 * Experience working with phase-based and Agile delivery methods
 * Experience with Jira or other Agile tools
 * Ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical users
 * Must be able to work well both in a team environment and independently
 * Must possess exceptional attention to detail
 * Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
 * Familiarity with government projects and policy/procedures teams
 * Demonstrates ability to interact comfortably with Senior Leadership and/or Government Executives and staff on a day-to-day basis
 * Experience in managing client requirements and small teams
 * Excellent analytical skills and business presentation skills
   
   
   

Ideally, you will also have:


 * Experience supporting DHS HQ or other US Federal Agencies
 * Experience tracking and reporting project or program delivery progress and budget execution
 * Experience developing project briefs and reports for non-technical audiences
 * Knowledge of the federal acquisition lifecycle
 * Familiarity with Business Intelligence and Data Analytics
 * Project Management, Agile, and/or Cyber Certifications (PMP / ACP / CSM / SAFe / CISM)
   
   
   

Our Commitment:

Contact Government Services (CGS) strives to simplify and enhance government bureaucracy through the optimization of human, technical, and financial resources. We combine cutting-edge technology with world-class personnel to deliver customized solutions that fit our client’s specific needs. We are committed to solving the most challenging and dynamic problems.

For the past seven years, we’ve been growing our government contracting portfolio, and along the way, we’ve created valuable partnerships by demonstrating a commitment to honesty, professionalism, and quality work.

Here at CGS we value honesty through hard work and self-awareness, professionalism in all we do, and to deliver the best quality to our consumers mending those relations for years to come.

We care about our employees. Therefore, we offer a comprehensive benefits package.


 * Health, Dental, and Vision
 * Life Insurance
 * 401k
 * Flexible Spending Account (Health, Dependent Care, and Commuter)
 * Paid Time Off and Observance of State/Federal Holidays
   
   
   

Contact Government Services, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will be considered without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Join our team and become part of government innovation!

Explore additional job opportunities with CGS on our Job Board:

https://cgsfederal.com/join-our-team/

For more information about CGS please visit: https://www.cgsfederal.com or contact:

Email: info@cgsfederal.com

title: Business Analyst-Tx
description:
Job Title: Business Analyst



Job Description:

 * Entry Level expertise in gathering, analyzing, and documenting business requirements. If you do not have experience as a Business Analyst or Product Owner, you will be put through a training & Internship program.
 * Experience in Requirement Gathering, Agile methodology, writing user stories, and building and planning roadmaps.
 * Experience in preparing functional and detailed system design documents
 * Demonstrate expertise with SDLC methodology
 * Ability to communicate effectively across multiple levels of the organization, including with leadership.
 * Demonstrated leadership, initiative, analytical skills, and sound business acumen, including the ability to understand and analyze recommendations

 * Must be able to adjust and work effectively in a dynamic, changing environment

Other:

 * Individuals on F1/OPT are welcome to apply.
