title: Business Analyst 5
description:
Hello,

Hope you are doing good.

Position: Business Analyst 5

Location: Lansing, MI (Hybrid)

Duration: 12+ Months

Client: State of MI

Job ID: 131136

Job Description


 * This position is partially remote. The candidate will be required to report to a Lansing, MI office location on a regular basis.
   
   

The selected candidate will be responsible for any and all costs associated with parking for this position.

Top Skills & Years Of Experience


 * Strong oral and written communication skills are mandatory
 * Experience in interface and integration testing
 * Data migration experience
 * Minimum of 15+ years of experience in the field
   
   

Will close submissions on: 6/7 at 10am EST.

Business Analyst 5 –


 * Start Date: Immediate (based on agreement with the selected candidate)
 * End date: At will, but is expected to be at least one year from start date with high probability of being extended
 * Maximum Number of Annual Hours: 1,984
   
   

Short Description: This project resource will work with the Michigan Department of Corrections to review, analyze, and evaluate business processes around the implementation of a new enterprise-level software solution that will replace numerous aging legacy systems. Special emphasis will be placed on integration/interface processes and data migration.

Complete Description: This project resource will work with the Michigan Department of Corrections to review, analyze, and evaluate functional requirements and business user needs around the implementation of a new enterprise-level software solution that will replace numerous aging legacy systems.

A special emphasis will be placed on testing the software solution prior to implementation and working with the project’s quality assurance team to prepare for and complete large-scale testing efforts. Demonstrable testing skills will be a highly desired skill set. This resource must be experienced in coordinating, designing, and implementing test plans in conjunction with a third-party software vendor and agency staff.

Special consideration will be given to candidates with integration/interface development experience and/or those with data migration experience.

Candidates with experience in gathering business requirements and functional requirements within State of Michigan agencies and transforming those requirements into clear and precise language are highly valued. This resource will also be expected to support subject matter experts and other project team members by drafting design documents, being accountable for assuring that documents are filed on time, and that project vendors are provided accurate feedback on a range of deliverables.

This resource must be experienced in coordinating and communicating the efforts of multiple groups of technical and business groups (e.g. enterprise architecture analysts, database administrators, data scientists, business analysts, ETL developers, business subject matter experts, quality assurance and testing resources, and end users) in conjunction with a third-party software vendor. This project resource may also be responsible for developing and maintaining a system capable of tracking all assigned tasks.

This position has a high probability of being extended past the end date listed.

Years of Experience: Fifteen (15) or more years of experience in the field.

Additional Responsibilities


 * Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs
 * Facilitates user meetings for eliciting business process requirements and functional requirements
 * Prepares detailed descriptions of user needs, business functions, and the steps required to develop or modify automated systems to mirror business practices
 * Prepares State of Michigan project templates in accordance with proper procedures
 * Is adept at proofing documents for errors in business and technical descriptions and overall grammar and spelling
 * Assists in the deployment and management of user reporting tools and platforms
 * Documents and provides knowledge transfer
 * Has knowledge of commonly used concepts, practices, and procedures within the enterprise-level software field
 * Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals, independently performs a variety of complicated tasks, and a wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected
 * Is a team player and willing to take on tasks that may not be “in my swim lane” in order to move the project forward
 * Demonstrable leadership and communication skills will be a highly desired skill set
   
   

Expert verbal and written communication with clients and technical staff in English along with ability to proof documents in English

Expert skill in developing business and functional requirements and transforming those requirements into clear and precise language

Experience in testing and evaluating software in a test environment, analyzing software functionality against design documents, and efficiently utilizing a testing suite such as Azure Dev. Ops.

Documented experience in leading in-person requirements gathering sessions for systems implementations

Proven experience in creating system documentation, user manuals, and/or operation documentation

Experience in coordinating and leading multiple technical and business teams with data cleaning and data migration efforts within the context of a large software implementation project

Experience in identifying data cleaning and data migration risks and assisting in the resolution of project issues

Experience documenting data cleaning and data migration plans, and explaining such plans to technical teams, business teams, and vendors

Experience drafting requirement traceability matrices and test plans for requirements validation.

Experience using enterprise testing, data cleaning, and data migration tools.

Experience working within projects involving vendor owned, designed, and hosted solutions

Experience with State of Michigan SUITE methodology and related documentation.

Experience working directly for a corrections department or other law enforcement agency as a business analyst focused on large-scale enterprise IT systems

Bachelor’s degree

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
Job Summary:

We are seeking a highly detail-oriented and experienced Business Analyst / Product Owner to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in documenting functional requirements, writing clear and actionable user stories, and managing product backlogs. This role requires experience with complex business applications, particularly those related to business workflows and analytics.

Key Responsibilities:

Backlog Manager:

 * Manage the product and sprint backlogs, ensuring that prioritized user stories are delivered on time and meet project goals.

Facilitator:

 * Lead discussions, support the removal of obstacles, and keep the team focused and on track to meet deadlines.

Requirements Manager:

 * Oversee the entire requirements lifecycle, ensuring high-quality requirements are captured, refined, and delivered effectively.

Documentation & Requirement Gathering:

 * Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and document detailed functional requirements.
 * Write clear, concise, and well-structured user stories that can be effectively translated to developers.
 * Ensure all documentation is thorough, consistent, and easily understandable by both technical and non-technical team members.

Backlog Management:

 * Manage and prioritize the product backlog to align with business goals and project timelines.
 * Translate business requests into epics, user stories, and tasks that can be efficiently executed by the development team.
 * Continuously refine and adjust the backlog based on stakeholder feedback and changing business needs.

Cross-functional Collaboration:

 * Work closely with developers, designers, and QA teams to ensure that requirements are understood and implemented correctly.
 * Act as a liaison between technical teams and business stakeholders to ensure alignment on project goals and deliverables.

Complex Business Applications:

 * Utilize your experience with complex business applications to drive the design and implementation of robust solutions.
 * Apply knowledge of business workflows, analytics, and insights to contribute to the development of applications that meet business needs.

Stakeholder Communication:

 * Communicate progress, changes, and challenges to stakeholders effectively.
 * Facilitate meetings, workshops, and discussions to gather requirements and feedback.

Quality Assurance & Testing:

 * Collaborate with QA teams to ensure that developed solutions meet the documented requirements.
 * Participate in testing phases, including writing test cases and validating outcomes.

Qualifications:

Education & Experience:

 * Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or a related field.
 * 3+ years of experience as a Business Analyst, Product Owner, or in a similar role.
 * Proven experience working on complex business applications, particularly those involving business workflows and analytics.

Skills:

 * Strong documentation skills with meticulous attention to detail.
 * Proficiency in writing clear and actionable functional requirements and user stories.
 * Experience managing product backlogs, epics, and user stories.
 * Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
 * Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
 * Experience with Agile/Scrum methodologies is preferred.

Tools & Technologies:

 * Familiarity with project management tools like JIRA, Confluence, or similar.
 * Experience with workflow automation tools and analytics platforms is a plus.

title: Business analyst (WCAG)
description:

Work Location: Harrisburg, PA

Applicant must have 5 Years of experience with the following.

sector: Government Administration and Government Relations Services

title: Business Analyst/Consultant-IV - 1836
description:
Business Analyst/Consultant-IV

Job ID: CER 1836

Location: Madison, WI, 53705

Schedule: Remote

Compensation: 1099: W2: (No C2C) Listed on Skills Matrix

Requirements


 * This position can work 100% remote. The selected candidate will have to work in the office occasionally or as business needs arise. If the selected hire is required to come onsite, it is their responsibility to cover any costs for travel, lodging and meals.
 * No WI residency required. Open to nationwide candidates.
   
   

Submission Instructions


 * Download & Complete Skills Matrix:
    * Click here for SkillsMatrix and go to File > Select Download option > Select .doc version

 * Apply Online:
    * Go to CertecIncOpenJobs
    * Look for the above Job ID & Click on EASY APPLY
    * Fill the required details (Mandatory: Resume, SkillsMatrix, LinkedIn)
      

Note: Applications via certecinc.com Easy Apply ONLY will be reviewed

We'll cut off considering resumes on 09/8 at Noon CST.

Under general supervision from the deputy director of the Office of Enterprise Initiatives (OEI), on enterprise projects, initiatives, and processes, this advanced level position works as a liaison amongst technical and business stakeholders to facilitate the development of business requirements, lead business process redefinition studies and analyze the use of new technology for new or enhanced systems services. This position is responsible for working with business leads and subject matter experts (SMEs) from various ETF program areas to understand business structure, policies, and operations in order to develop solutions to business-related issues and achieve ETF and business unit strategic goals and initiatives. Including, but not limited to, defining/refining metrics and creating dashboards and standard operating procedures for projects, leading the creation, and assisting with the execution and completion of user acceptance testing (UAT), and assisting project managers and/or business units with defining project benefits and costs. Responsible for understanding current and future processes, including processes for the entire enterprise. The work product will impact the enterprise, as well as extra and/or inter-agency business on critical business activities.

This position, along with business leads and SMEs, will analyze current business processes and identify changes in business processes and/or IT systems that will improve ETF’s ability to meet customer needs and/or improve operating efficiency in a member-centric organization. This may include developing use cases and/or test plans to illustrate current state to future state definition and developing and validating detailed system requirements and design specifications. This position interacts with business users to assure a mutual understanding and agreement on requirements and specifications and, at an expert level, provides consultation, direction, and guidance to business managers.

This is a senior-level position performing difficult and complex work reviewing policies, priorities, recommendations, and/or solutions to IT and business-related issues. This person will serve as the principal authority in the analysis of business process definition/redefinition projects, with little supervision, and providing expertise in multiple projects of moderate to difficult scope and complexity. This position requires knowledge of project management principles, methods, and practices.

Ensuring effective and efficient interactions with staff and management at all organizational levels and areas of ETF is an essential part of this position.

Goals and Worker Activities

30% GOAL A. Leadership, facilitation, and coordination of business and operational teams to ensure that ETF’s business needs are being met.

Worker

Activity A1. Lead, facilitate, and coordinate team meetings to prioritize work requests in partnership with the business leads from assigned business areas.

A2. Serve as the key integration point between the business areas, operations teams, and IT.

A3. Develop and maintain a deep understanding and expertise of applicable operational processes, procedures, and controls.

A4. Work with key stakeholders to fully understand and analyze the business case for each work effort.

25% GOAL B. Leadership, facilitation and coordination of business process and systems analysis

Worker

Activity B1. Lead, facilitate and coordinate business requirements at the appropriate level of detail for each work effort, ensuring the cross-functional impacts and any required coordination/integration effort has been identified ahead of the solution.

B2. Work with internal and external stakeholders to gather and validate business requirements and assist with the functional design of solutions.

B3. Partner with the technical lead to provide input into the functional aspects of solutions design.

B4. Proactively identify opportunities for process, system, or other enhancements that may help the business mitigate operational risk and/or achieve its business goals.

B5. Partner with the technical lead to create or update documentation relating to workflow process and detailed procedures resulting from implemented initiatives prior to deployment.

B6. Develop end-user training materials, in partnership with the transition manager, and assist with the coordination of user training, if needed.

B7. Serve as an internal expert with regards to the integrated end-to end processes, controls, and solutions employed by ETF to manage the business.

25% GOAL C. Management of quality control efforts

Worker

Activity C1. Develop, execute, and document user test plans and organize and oversee end-user testing and acceptance.

C2. Provide support to test teams, as needed.

C3. Coordinate resolution of issues uncovered during end-user testing.

C4. Research escalated business issues and lead the creation of integrated models/workflows that resolve the root cause of these problems.

C5. Participate in the evaluation, provide feedback, and resolve issues regarding vendor performance, escalating to the lead project manager as needed.

C6. Independently resolve issues to remove roadblocks and provide reports or updates on issues to the portfolio owner, as needed.

C7. Maintain and distribute metrics related to work request/project, as agreed upon.

15% GOAL D. Participation on the Business Process and Analysis (BPA) Center of Excellence

Worker

Activity D1. Provide direction and training to other staff in the use of business analysis and process tools, techniques, metrics, standards, and best practices.

D2. Promote, recommend revisions to, and lead the development of business analysis policies, processes/procedures, standards/guidelines, and tools/templates for OEI and the enterprise, ensuring consistency and repeatability.

D3. Monitor business analysis processes, tools, standards, guidelines, and templates for adherence to industry and ETF-specific standards.

D4. Create common ground between business units and IT services to ensure IT staff have the requirements and information to deliver technical solutions that support the business needs.

D5. Strive for continuous process improvement through identifying root cause of problems and developing solutions, providing mapping services, and inspiring the organization with new ways of thinking and new ways of doing business.

5% GOAL E. Performance of special assignments and professional development

Worker

Activity E1. Stay abreast of business analysis trends and best practices.

E2. Represent the Department on enterprise-wide and/or Department committees, as assigned.

Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities


 * Expert ability to analyze enterprise-wide business and technology issues in a large or complex organization and be able to document and communicate business knowledge.
 * Demonstrated ability to identify appropriate members and develop effective teams with specific knowledge and skills needed to develop solutions and make recommendations.
 * Ability to independently identify and obtain information sources needed to perform responsibilities effectively and efficiently.
 * Advanced ability to recognize how and when to improve a process and to recommend, negotiate, and implement change.
 * Comprehensive experience in business process analysis, new business process design, quality/process improvement, and change management.
 * Advanced experience and ability at identifying key points and communicating results accurately and effectively to a broad audience.
 * Thorough knowledge and understanding of the software development lifecycle including requirements analysis, design, testing, and deployment.
 * Advanced skills with Microsoft Office (i.e. Excel, Word, Access, etc.).
 * Working knowledge of project management methods, tools, and techniques, including MS Visio; experience working with project management software.
 * Broad experience and ability in influencing others and encouraging creative thinking to identify solutions.
 * Expert ability obtaining information and insight even when others are reluctant to share.
 * Highly developed communication, interpersonal, and team building skills to develop and sustain effective working relationships, including facilitation and leadership skills.
 * Skill in establishing and maintaining effective contact and communication with staff and management at all levels of the organization and with external groups/individuals.
 * Expert ability to communicate business and technical concepts and information effectively to a wide range of audiences.
 * Considerable ability to work as an effective member in a team environment and to mentor more junior staff.
 * Ability to work independently and exercise appropriate judgment with a minimum of supervision and produce effective, acceptable results within defined time frames.
 * Ability to take the initiative to assertively represent business needs, to stand firm when necessary and to compromise, when possible, to diplomatically challenge assumptions, and to make recommendations to business and technical staff at all levels of responsibility and authority throughout the organization.
 * Highly skilled in effective time management and priority-setting.
 * Demonstrated ability to analyze facts and apply sound judgment in decision making.
 * Ability to understand and comply with all ETF security standards, policies, processes, and procedures.
 * Certification of Competency in Business Analysis (CCBATM) Designation, Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP®) Designation, or equivalent preferred.
   
   

Top Skills & Years Of Experience


 * At least 5 years of experience - Lead, facilitate, and coordinate business requirements gathering. Validate the requirements and assist with the functional design of solutions.
 * At least 5 years of experience - Develop, execute, and document test plans and organize and oversee end-user testing and acceptance. Track defects and coordinate resolutions.
 * At least 5 years of experience - Research, perform analysis, and provide recommendations for solutions that meet business needs and fit within the system/software capabilities.
 * At least 5 years of experience – Writing SQL queries and creating sources to target mapping documents.
   
   

Nice To Have


 * 5+ years of experience doing business analysis on large and complex IT projects.
 * Experience in Government, Insurance Industry or Pension Plans.
